author: Michael's_Mom_1
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2017
review_content: I thought I would be a good candidate to leave a review because I buy and own every pain cream known to science and could give a difference in comparison and to other pain creams on the market and how they work. I have cervical  degenerative disk disease, fibromyalgia and rheumatoid arthritis. If it is rated good then I buy it.There are a lot of pain cream on the market. Those that give instant relief such as Biofreeze, Icy Hot, etc. And those that provide some instant relief but work better the longer you use it. Examples include Blue Emu and Penetrex which are specifically for inflamation. It helps the nerves too by reducing the inflamation off the nerve. Penetrex and Blue emu are both more natural products that are better to use for a few weeks to see maximum benefits. You do see immediate results, enough to take the edge off but the longer you use It the better they work. This product is not a miracle but it does help. I'm only having to use it 1-2 times a day now instead of every 3-4 hours like when I first started two to three weeks ago. You need to give it time for maximum effects. I can't give the product 5 stars because it's too similar to Blue emu which is cheaper. It's also no miracle cure.. However It does work slightly better then Blue emu and the 4 ounce bottle lasts longer.Another surprising thing is that it does help my severe herniated disks, I'm scheduled for surgery. I was told nothing would help it. In all honesty it just reduces the pain from an 8 to a 6 to take the edge off but that in itself that is fantastic for someone with spinal compression and massive disk issues. It helps my arthritis too. The disks not as much but it does help. Blue emu does about the same though but Penetrex is a tad better but not enough to justify the cost difference in my opinion. $13 vs $36. But I've only been using it for about three weeks and I'm sure the longer you use the better because a few weeks ago I was much more stiff and in a lot more pain then I am now. Blue emu is only $13 for 4 ounces and Penetrex is $37 for 4 ounces. I think Penetrex works slightly better then Blue emu but not much. I do think it's overpriced. I do notice that the container of Penetrex lasts longer then Blue emu just because it's thicker and spreads more so that makes up for some of the price so I can get an extra 10 days approx  out of Penetrex. Blue emu has no smell at all and Penetrex has a vague light peppermint smell.I notice if you severely overuse Penetrex it can make you slightly itchy. I have sensitive skin. By that I mean applying way too much and way too often otherwise there are 0 side effects. I used it today and no itch. Penetrex and Blue emu does not cool the skin like Biofreeze or ICY HOT, it's like using a lotion but it helps which is crazy how it reaches far enough to reduce inflamation. You don't have to worry about strong odors. It's hard to fathom that something that doesn't cool or heat the skin could help but they both DO. I'm not telling you which you should purchase because I feel Penetrex works better then Blue emu but just a little, not a big difference and the cost is steep in comparison although it also lasts longer. I will say that the company Penetrex does give a no questions asked refund if you are not happy you can request an immediate refund so they stand behind there product 100%. If you are in severe pain (stiffness and burning) like I was I highly recommend rotating ICY HOT or BIOFREEZE with either Blue Emu or Penetrex inflamation cream for maximum benefits. I think BIOFREEZE or ICY HOT will take more of the edge off to give the Blue emu or Penetrex time to really kick in. Both do work  immediately but the longer you use It the better and you will notice you don't need it as often. Just as anti inflamitory meds work immediately , they also work better the longer you use them as does both Penetrex and Blue emu.When I first developed the herniation I had not heard of Penetrex. I was using ICY HOT and rotating with Blue Emu to maximize effects. I swore ICY HOT was better then Blue emu, at least somewhat better and cheaper. It took Blue emu time to really start helping, although it helped immediately to take the edge off but not a ton. Each day I noticed more relief. Then Google and Amazon brought me to Penetrex so I wanted to try it as it was the number one best seller. What I do right now is the days I have less pain I do Blue emu and days I have more pain I do Penetrex. When I run out of Penetrex I may stick to just Blue emu. A month ago I was in such bad shape I was using Blue emu and Icy hot in rotation every few hours and that's when I decided to buy Penetrex and started using ALL 3 in rotation. That may seem crazy but when you are in that much pain you will do anything. Now I'm only using Penetrex every few days and Blue emu daily unless I over do it and the pain flares up too much then I use Penetrex.Note: The box says to not use product after too much physical exertion or after hot baths which is confusing. I see that as not happening for me so I broke the rule but I was slightly paranoid. Lol. I take hot epsom salt baths twice a week. I did use this after my bath with no effects outside slight itching/warming feeling on my neck. Blue emu does the same only if I use after a hot bath. Seeing as these do not normally warm or cool on the skin but only happens after a hot bath for me is a little odd. Lol. But I didn't have any crazy side effects. I also use this after cleaning the house and haven't noticed any side effects. Only after my hot baths. A little warm on my neck after applying it which lasts for about 10 minutes..This was definitely the longest review I've ever written but I felt the need to share the difference in these creams and also explain some in how they work different from other creams that cool or heat the skin. The main reason is because I read too many reviews which did not even give the product time to work before saying it's a scam etc. I'm a real buyer and it's not a scam. It's no miracle either but it does help a good 20% of the pain for severe pain and at  least 50%  for mild to moderate pain. I find both Penetrex and Blue emu the best on the market you can buy followed by BIOFREEZE then lastly ICY HOT. My top 3 in order is #1 PENETREX #2. BLUE EMU, #3 BIOFREEZE. #4 ICYHOT. I read Sombra works good too But that's one I've yet to personally try. I think Biofreeze helps the muscles more and Blue emu and Penetrex helps the joints more but they help the muscles too.  It does work immediately to take the edge off but again it takes a few weeks to see a better improvement and the improvement is deserving of 4 stars and if the price was lower it would get 5 stars.. But that's why to start out I recommend rotating with a cooling cream to give this time to see the best results.My mobility is better, stiffness and I can tell the inflamation is down. It helps more then my prescription anti inflammatory.  I really hope this helped your decision and gave some insight in to the different creams.. . :)
title: Works better the longer you use it.

author: Y. Cohn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2018
review_content: The arthritis in my right wrist was actually reaming out loud painful. The wrong movement and I was in intense pain. When an ad for Penetrex popped up, I wrote it off as the usual medical con.I never trusted money back guarantees, but I was in such pain, and this was, after all through Amazon, so I ordered a 2 oz jar.My arthritis is not cured, but it’s now bearable. For the most part, only motion on one direction hurts, and not nearly as bad as before.I’m embarrassed to tell my orthopedist that this stuff works, when the steroids and the other $200 shots didn’t.Will Penetrex really honor the money back guarantee?  I’ll never know.  I finished the 2 oz and am now working through a 4 oz jar.
title: I can’t believe it myself

author: J. Nelson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2018
review_content: I was skeptical going in to an all natural pain relief cream for joints. I've had knee problems since I got out of the Army, and have broken a kneecap as well. Running makes my arthritis act up, and between this cream and a knee compression sleeve, after 3 days I had no more pain while running. I'm honestly amazed. I just ordered the 3 pack of 4 oz jars off the website directly to get the discount, and after having used half the jar, gave it to a buddy who recently injured his knee as well. He states the same relief, with the same treatment, after the same amount of time. He messed his up in the Marine Corps, and is currently doing the 300 workout and states that the cream and a compression sleeve has completely relieved the pain in his joints, and now only suffers the expected sore muscles from the workout. I recommend.
title: EMS skeptic, but now I recommend it to joint pain sufferers like myself.

author: LB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2017
review_content: OMG THANK YOU PENETREX!UPDATE : well 3 years since my first review. I’m still in love with this stuff. I actually just purchased the 4 ounce 3 pack for $98. I know it probably seems crazy to some people to spend that much on a pain cream but for the relief it provides it’s worth it.I have multiple chronic illnesses (Gastroparesis, Ehlers Danlos Syndrome, Endometriosis, arthritis, trigger finger, carpal tunnel, Interstial Cystitis, Chronic Migraines, IBSDC... )With all of these ailments comes chronic pain. I’ve been using it consistently a couple times a day starting when I first wake up - I run it on my neck and shoulders, my temples, my abdomen, my hips, my tailbone... it really does make a huge difference. I do wish it wasn’t so expensive but again anything that reduces my pain and improves my quality of life even just a little bit is worth it.ORIGINAL POST :This stuff is amazing.  I love it.  I've had it for a week and a half and it's already made such a HUGE difference in my life.  I have carpal tunnel in my arm and I've been rubbing this on it continuously since I received it.  Since then I can feel a difference in my tendons.  I use Icy Hot all the time which is great for temporary relief, but it's more like a bandaid.  Where as Penetrex is meant to truly heal the pain deeply over time from repeated use.  I was reluctant but now I wish I would have gotten a bigger container....I can see myself swimming in this..... my entire body benefits from this.  IF you are someone who is suffering from Chronic pain do yourself a favor and treat yourself to this much deserved treatment.
title: I love Penetrex

author: Bev
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2017
review_content: This is the third time I've ordered Penetrex since December. I thought I'd be fine without it, but was I wrong. For the last two or three years, I've lived with intermittent severe and chronic pain in my feet caused by rheumatoid arthritis. The pain sometimes keeps from standing or walking for extended periods of time. Over the course of six or eight weeks, Penetrex has helped. It helped so much, I thought I no longer needed it. Not so. The pain is under control. I can now skip a day or two with no ill effect. When I started, I applied it four times a day. Now, usually once in the morning is fine. If i've been on my feet a great deal, I apply some at night as well. At times, my toes cramp. Massaging Penetrex into my toes and feet offers almost immediate relief. It's a good product.
title: Good Product--Relief from RA Pain

author: Bill Schmitz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2017
review_content: After a lifetime of hockey, football, baseball, racquetball, golf, running and biking, at 53 I was beginning to believe the old knees were completely shot.After going through years of cortisone shots, physical therapy, anti-inflammatory drugs and seemingly every topical treatment known to man I was starting to mentally prepare for the seemingly inevitable knee replacement surgery my orthopedist was trying to sell me. Bone on bone osteoarthritis had set in 5-6 years ago and just seemed to be degeneratively progressing.Then...are you ready for it?...I put anti-inflammatory in my Amazon search bar and the Penetrex came up with as the #1 best seller with nearly 18,000 mostly stunning reviews. What?Since I have spent untold thousands on knee pain what was 19 bucks for 2 ounces?  Nothing.Product arrived in usual 2 day Prime fashion and I opened it up and put it on my knees. 5 minutes later the pain had subsided 75%. From there I followed the directions and after a week the pain was virtually non-existent. It's certainly incredible and seemingly unbelievable yet it's the truth. I have since purchased 4 ounce packages and plan to have this product on hand at all times in the future. Constant pain really does decrease quality of life and eliminating that pain has been a Godsend and just makes me so happy to have found something that stops my knees from aching constantly.Go for it as you have nothing to lose but your horrible pain. I don't really care how it works, just that it magnificently does. Sounds a little crazy I know, for me though, the result of utilizing Penetrex has been crazy great!
title: Constant Knee Pain, He Gone!

author: Pamela K. Elliott
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2017
review_content: Warning.  This significantly worsened all of my pain and I would have ended up in the emergency room if I hadn't had strong pain medication at home to take.  My pain has never been that severe and it frightened me.  I'm certain it was the DMSO in it.  DMSO is dangerous because it can cause systemic infections and can even be fatal.  It shouldn't be sold here and is illegal in some states.  Biomax wasn't going to refund me for unopened, unused product so I contacted Amazon.com who did refund me and told me not to return it.  It went in the garbage.
title: It went in the garbage.

author: Jose E. Cantu
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2019
review_content: This product has ingredients that are common natural ingredients but these ingredients have never been proven as completely effective nor approved by the FDA for genuine pain or supplemental use. It's subjective and there are certainly no rules governing what can be mixed together and advertised. It has arnicab(a common cream), mint which gives it a tingly feel and camphor, an unpleasant ointment smell. The cream doesn't dissolve well.Very upset that it can't be returned as it's just a hoax. The lid says "The World's BEST customer service". Very misleading. It gives the impression the cream is the best. Save your $34 and buy an over the counter pain relief ointment that dissolves fast, isn't greasy or smells, or maybe your doctor will prescribe one that works. There are NO real pain relievers in the product, nothing pharmaceutical level - that would be illegal.It has chemicals, isn't organic or medical grade pain relief.The directions say to massage in for 7-10 days, THREE or FOUR TIMES A DAY! After as needed. I asked a physician that said of course, massage is a great pain reliever, especially 3-4 times a day. Might make a good pedicure moisturizer with socks. You can buy Nivea cream and add arnica, peppermint & camphor and other oils, stir it up, rub it in four times a day and just the massage itself would feel good.
title: INEFFECTIVE!

author: marina slotterbach
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2018
review_content: Guys, it doesn’t work at all. Not sure if all the positive reviews got paid for it...but believe me it doesn’t work at all. I am a nurse and tried many things for pain on patients and myself. Maybe Tiger Balm works a little. This stuff is garbage, seriously. Waste of money. Generally I would just go for acupuncture or take anti inflammatory stuff in the beginning along with arnica, use ice and then warm after a week. Good deep tissue massage but not right away. Magnesium lotion and collagen as long term treatments...
title: Overrated

author: Y R DeLoach
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2019
review_content: My recent MRI showed steady encroachment of osteoarthritis in my spine, medium to severe levo scoliosis and medium to severe narrowing of my spinal column (stenosis).  My doctor also confirmed that a compressed nerve in the lumbar spinal area was the culprit for my sciatica.At present, I would rate my pain factor to be a constant 8.I am also a full time family caregiver for a 96 year old parent that refuses outside help.To help alleviate my pain and create better mobility, I decided to give the Penetrex a try.  I am currently a menthol pain patch user along with some pretty heavy duty medications that prevent me from experiencing 'quality of life'.The first application took about seven minutes to take effect and provide enough relief to my hips, right leg and right shoulder, that I could actually walk upright and 'straight' without pain.  The absence of my nerve pain was so remarkable I actually burst out laughing and crying at the same time.That isn't to say the pain stayed away, but the first application did last a good solid three hours,Caring for my father is an important part of my life, and somewhere in there I also need to care for myself.  The first 15 years were pretty easy as my health was great.  Three years ago I was told about what my future would hold with the diagnosis of osteoarthritis, stenosis and scoliosis.Saying thank you for a great product seems a small thing.  I'm only hoping I'll be able to continue using it.
title: Dibilitating nerve pain relief

author: Danny Magana
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2019
review_content: I started using this product in 2012 while deployed to Afghanistan. I had a nagging elbow pain and decided to be more proactive than just using ibuprofen. I used Penetrex in conjunction with an elbow sleeve and the pain eventually disappeared. I did modify my training in and out of the gym as much as I could.Since then I have used it on my knees for nagging pain. I usually apply before putting knee sleeves on for training. I’ve used it post Achilles’ tendon rerupture reconstruction surgery with a scraping tool to reduce scar tissue and regain as much flexibility and blood flow as possible. I use it with shoulder pain and wrist pain as well.Although I am only 29 I have a long list of injuries and I have been using this cream for a very long time. It is not a magical cream that can just fix any one issue. This should be used in conjunction  with Healthy habits. You cannot try and apply this cream and expect all your issues to be solved. Be cognizant of your habits and try to find out what your issue may be. For example, wrist pain in the office. Perhaps your posture is bad and you are applying too much pressure on your wrist. Simply adding Penetrex and continuing to do the same thing will not work. There may be temporary relief but the root cause is still there.Penetrex pros:-Easy to apply-Minimal scent (you will be able to smell it when you apply but it goes away)-Provides temporary pain relief and can help reduce inflammation -portable (you can take it anywhere)Cons-cost (you are getting a good product, but with much use the costs add up)
title: Believer since 2012

author: HeavyLunch
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2016
review_content: Works great but man is this stuff expensive.  You can't put a price on getting better right?  Well apparently these guys can.  It really helped me through a tennis elbow bout.  Tried several other topical remedies including DSMO and BIoFreeze, but they were like slingshots in a nucelar war.  This was the Multiple Warhead Delivery Vehicle needed for said nuclear war.  But I feel like I paid 80's era Reagan defense spending prices for this stuff too.  I would use it more frequently for other ailments, but I would need to rob a bank, so no.  But great product.  Use it if you need to, then switch back to the cheaper stuff that works on the more minor ailments.  4oz will not last you very long.  It goes fast.
title: Works Great....Costs a fortune.

author: SF
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2018
review_content: After 3 days of application a weird thing happened—-While I was in the grocery store checking out Suddenly I felt my heart beat ramp up and I started physically shaking so bad I could hardly Insert my credit card into the reader - I stopped using the cream and the further I get away from using the cream the better I’m starting to feel.
title: Made my heart rate speed up

author: Khalid
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2016
review_content: Penetrex - Pain Relief Cream, 2 Oz :: Ranked #1 in Medications & Treatments 5 Years Running. 100% Unconditionally Guaranteed.          My wife suffered from Sciatica pains when she fell down from a chair and a pinched nerve caused that painful conditions.Doctors recommended surgery but my wife refused to undergo the knife of the surgeon.Ultimately it was decided that cortisone shot should be given a chance.It reduced the inflammation and my wife could at last feel comfortable in her daily life.But the problem was she could not sit on any chair,sofa or travel in a car for long without getting strain or pain in the legs forcing her occasionally to take painkillers Duaxis, Celebrex and relying more on Voltaren Gel.In Oct.2014, I was browsing, on Amazon, for creams/gels relieving sciatica pain.Pentrex caught my attention with over 4000 reviews.I read negative and positive reviews and decided to give it a try.I ordered for one jar on the 5th of October.Delivery was prompt on Amazon Prime.My wife tried it the next time she felt the strain in her legs and surprisingly it worked miraculously.Since that day, she has stopped taking painkillers which were terrible on her stomach.We have purchased five jars till date;two of them for my sister-in-law in Pakistan who had the same problem.The cream is not sticky and has a pleasant smell.It is not only' a pain reliever but has the properties of an anti-inflammatory cream.I hope this review will help the people who are looking for some real good anti-inflammatory and pain reliever cream.Khalid Anwar
title: PENETREX

author: VP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2019
review_content: My mother has been in and out of doctors for years trying to find out what is wrong with her. Her feet and arms swell randomly and her skin also blisters as well. She used to be a very active person and this drastic change has been really difficult for her. She can't do as much as she wants and is constantly in pain and in tears because of her fibromyalgia.I found this cream online through Buzzfeed and thought I would buy it for my mother. She was really doubtful that it would work but her opinion has done a 180. She isn't 100% better. She still has her swelling and some pain, but she can manage it now. She has called me crying on the phone because she can finally start doing the things that she likes to do. She understands that from now on, she will always be in pain for the rest of her life, but at least now she can improve her quality of life because of this.She can feel when she is starting to have a flair up and immediately puts her cream on and can manage it a lot better. I think that this cream is at least worth a try.This has been a life saver!
title: Brought My Mother To Tears

author: Loki of Jotunheim
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2017
review_content: I am a current chronic sufferer of carpel tunnel, golfer/tennis elbow, plantar fasciitis of both feet, and arthritis in my back. I was in so very much pain from all these ailments, but th and carpel tunnel and plantar fasciitis were impacting my ability to work and to relax. I am a patrolling security guard and I am a gamer in my off hoursThis product, has done what it promised! Rubbing it on my forearms, elbows and feet before going to work. Leaves me with a full shift of relief! No swelling, aches, and very little sharp pain. I can barely believe it myself! Trust me.I received NOTHING for this review and I have tried many things for this pain. I went from being unable to work and relax without pain. To having my life and leisure back.
title: I would have sold my soul for this relief...

author: SADIELADY
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2017
review_content: Didn't work at all. What a waste of money. Tried several times. Nothing. Thought because it had homeopathic ingredients it would be great. Boy was I wrong.I'm updating my review. I bought this for my daughter. Didn't work for her. I have had neck pain for 2 days that pain meds didn't help. So I decided to try it. It immediately worked for me. So I would say depending on what kind of pain you're in will depend if it would work. It did help my pain.
title: Depends on pain

author: Mary Monroe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2018
review_content: My nightmare with arthritis began May 1 with an annoying twinge in my left hip.  By the end of the week, my hip and entire outer left thigh felt like they were on fire.  Nothing seemed to help.  My doctor set me up for the cortisone steroid shot.  I had to wait a week to get it done and suffered like you wouldn't believe until then.  When I got the shot they told me it could take a week or longer for me to feel a difference.  In the meantime, I was in so much pain I couldn't do much of anything but lie on the couch and suffer.  A friend told me about Penetrex.  Nothing else had worked so I didn't get my hopes up to high but I ordered two jars anyway.  I'm still waiting for the steroid shot to work, but I slathered some Penetrex on two nights ago and the first morning I was almost as good as new!  I thought I was dreaming.  Today, I am doing even better. I ordered four more jars and I will continue to use it as long as it works! This stuff is absolutely wonderful!  Last week I literally had to crawl and hop around my apartment I was in so much pain.  I feel good enough to go dancing now.
title: Penetrex is amazing!

author: Jenni
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2017
review_content: I've had this a week and use it twice a day for plantar fasciitis. I also got a foot wrap at the same time so it's hard to tell which is doing the most to help. I definitely have less pain and more comfort walking. I don't wear the foot wraps every day, so it lends me to believe that this is helping some. Is it a cure All? I never thought it would be. I banked on it just simply helping because there were days I literally could not walk! My feet feel much better, they aren't pain free, but better. I do believe this is doing what it says it will do by reducing swelling to eleviate pain. When I put it on at night before bed, in the morning I do feel I have less pain than I did before I started using this product.Because it works as well as in expected, I guess I really should give 5 stars, but I feel like that might mislead people who think this is going to cure all that ails them. And this just won't do that.
title: It works exactly like I expected...but don't expect it to be the cure all.

author: JustJNL
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2018
review_content: This offered no pain relief at all, regardless how many times I rubbed it on my hands.  Not to mention, it is NON-RETURNABLE!  That alone should have been a big RED FLAG!  However, I never noticed that because Amazon is so good about returns.  The only thing I can say is that it doesn’t smell...doesn’t work, but doesn’t smell.  I had more relief by using fingerless compression gloves.  Save your money and buy them instead of this rubbish!
title: Does not work...AND is non-returnable!

author: Jayman1958
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2017
review_content: 0 for 2. Beware. I bought this stuff based on the great number of positive reviews. I have neuropathy and there’s a spot about the size of a dime on my foot that feels like someone is putting out a cigarette on it. It did not work. I also bought some for my mother’s arthritic knees. It did not work. We followed the directions applying several times a day for over 10 days. I’m surprised that it worked so well for so many. I certainly thought it would help with the arthritic knees. I didn’t have much faith that would it would work for neuropathy. It’s like Listerine many years ago, it claimed to treat things and it didn’t work. The Federal Trade Commission  made them remove those claims. This stuff also claims to treat a large number of afflictions. It is an anti-inflammatory cream so I don’t see how it can claim some of the things listed. It’s expensive for the amount you get. It’s going back. I hope this review helps somebody.
title: Heads Up

author: Peter Romano
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2018
review_content: I don't know. The reviews for this product don't live up to my experience. I've tried it according to the label and I've been trying it for 2 weeks. My hands still hurt from arthritis. I am losing my ability to grab things and my grip is getting weaker because of the pain. This product is doing nothing to live up to the hype.
title: Read between the lines of the amazing reviews.

author: JB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2019
review_content: Been using this product for over a few months now to absolutely no relief. Using four times a day for arthritis in Hands,neck,shoulders. Still no relief. I’m not sure where all these positive reviews are coming from? Have contacted Penetrex for some feedback as to what can be done for further relief but absolutely no replies back. I’ve seen a site that says to go to YouTube download what you think of product and they’ll give you three jars for free? Maybe that’s where the positive feedback comes from?
title: Doesn’t work

author: Donna D. Braendel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2018
review_content: I really didn't expect much from a cream in addressing sciatica and a bad knee. I had tried many such products before with some but not remarkable success. When I first tried this I did not notice any relief for a short while, and then as is common when chronic pain ceases for whatever reason,  I realized suddenly that I had much reduced pain. So much that I didn't notice it was gone at first.  It has continued to have the same effect and I have been using it now for 7 days. I am really impressed. The pain has steadily diminished in intensity even when I have not used it for a while.  Far better than common market creams of many types I have tried. I expect it may have varied results for different people but I am certain most would find it beneficial. It is now my constant companion. A faint mint scent is all I detect, and it fades quickly. The cream massages in well without much time or effort. This is a really great product.
title: Skeptical but was I wrong!

author: Vern Shaffer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2016
review_content: I purchased a small jar for my wife to try on her knee following arthroscopic surgery to repair a torn meniscus. She applied the Penetrex Cream 3 to 4 times a day when her knee started hurting following activity. She felt relief of discomfort and was able to resume her daily routine. She continues to apply the cream daily as a maintenance regimen. Recently, she has started to use the Penetrex Cream on her feet and hands to relief arthritic pain with positive results. As a Pharmacist, I have been aware of the anti-inflamatory properties of the Penetrex ingredients for many years. It was based on the Amazon reviews and this information that we decided to give it a try. We are glad we did. My wife is able to play golf, go to exercise class and yoga and walk without significant pain. We have purchased additional large jars for her and introduced it to other members of our family as well who suffer from inflammation and pain associated with arthritis. Bottom line, it works! If it didn't, we would not waste our money.
title: We are glad we did

author: Moms2cool
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2014
review_content: HI, Please consult with your physician before using this. This is my experience with this product. This is my second review of this product. I NEVER do that. I am 54 years old. I am also a registered nurse. My husband is a family physician.I have had 54 major surgeries over the past 27 years.I was one of the first people diagnosed with Fibromyalgia in 1982,by cutting edge rheumatologists out of Northwestern Memorial Medical Center in Chicago. I then developed Reflex Sympathetic Dystrophy three years later after a fall down a flight of stairs 7 months pregnant.and a severe neuropathy in my right foot. Then I developed another rare disease Preisers disease, where your scaphoid bone dies in your wrist. Extremely painful. I then proceeded to fracture my kneecap in 14 pieces. Add in a few spinal cord tumors, a massive foot tumor that left me with an open wound for 7 months this year, osteomyelitis a PICC line and IV antibiotics for 8 weeks this fall. I have had five major foot surgeries this year alone. I am telling you all this to say I have major aches and pains. The neuropathy in my foot is the worst. It feels like pins and needles then a hot poker being inserted all over my foot every few seconds. I have to take such massive doses of neurontin to keep it in check. Well that is causing huge open mouth and tongue sores. My tongue is so swollen I cannot talk. I decided I had nothing to lose by trying this cream. Due to all the bed rest from my foot tumor and subsequent surgeries, my knee is killing me. I also thought maybe it will improve the neuropathy in my foot. i had to wait for my foot to completely close and heal, which it finally did two weeks ago. I have been dealing with this foot issue for over two years. I am extremely pleased to say that after using this for the past two weeks, I am thrilled with the results. It takes about an hour, to relieve the symptoms in my foot, but it does. I have started to reduce the drug giving me mouth sores. It also makes my knee feel better too. It is not warm like ben gay, but I can feel it working. The key is Rub it in very very well. It is thick and you want to get it into the tissue, not have it lay on top of your skin. I hate to use the word miraculous but for me it has been. This stuff is great. I already went through a two ounce jar, and my 4 ounce jar arrived today. I am order two more 4 ounce jars, (cheaper that way) because I am never going to be out of this stuff. If I could take a bath in it I probably would. Please try this . You may get relief you never thought possible. I know I did.
title: Miraculous, Life Changing, Unbeliveable. Please Do Yourself a favor and try this stuff.

author: Apoiuwerhpga
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2019
review_content: This ointment is better than nothing.  But that is not saying much.  Probably without a prescription, a capsaicin ointment would be the best OTC treatment for arthritis.  That is my experience, after purchasing both this and capsaicin.  Capsaicin works better and is more benign.Noteworthy that this ointment comes with a warning not to use it longer than 7 - 10 days.  You should heed that warning because it likely exists for a reason.  Might be harming your liver, at the same time that it is relieving your pain.  So long as it is not FDA approved; you don't know.Anybody having chronic pain needs a diagnosis.  In my case, it is osteoarthritis.  And anybody who thinks that they have arthritis should have a doctor-supervised treatment plan that includes a prescription.  Arthritis should not be self-treated because self-treatment increases risk that it will worsen, whereas at least a doctor prescription can control it.
title: Got arthritis?  See a doctor.

author: GchanMako
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2016
review_content: Penetrex is a different kind of pain reliever as it doesnt give you the same tingling feel like others do. It hardly smells at all and when applied it is more like a cream or lotion rather than a balm or liquid rub. It is quite easy to apply to any sore muscle area and it absorbs rather quickly. I tried three products and compared it to this one. I used Tiger Balm, and Aspercreme.First Tiger Balm is a lot greasier than Penetrex and you have to wash it off after you apply it, or your hands will feel greasy. Penetrex absorbs in and you dont have to wash it off you hands. Tiger Balm rubs in about the same to the skin. But Tiger Balm will give you an immediate feeling of pain numbing versus the Penetrex which can take longer to feel. But the Penetrex does last longer. Tiger Balm also smells and you can definitely tell you are using it. The Penetrex has a very light odor and you have to really sniff to smell it.Aspercreme also rubs in very easily but you do need to wash your hands as well after use. It is more liquidy than Penetrex so it rubs in quicker. It also starts to numb quicker than Penetrex but it goes away a lot faster and does not seem to do as good as the Penetrex or Tiger Balm for pain relief.And so the winner for me is the Penetrex by a very slight margin over the Tiger Balm. What I like about it is that while it does not have an overwhelming sense of numbing, it does numb the pain and for a lot longer than the others. It rubs in very easily and dries out so you dont have to wash your hands and it doesnt leave an unpleasant odor. It still does not do much for chronic pain or substantial pain like a pain reliever but it does help with muscle soreness short term.  I have used half of the bottle, and I use it alot so it has lasted a long time.
title: Boom Pow - Penetrex Rubs on Easily and Does Well for Pain Relief

author: Sam Ahn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2019
review_content: I hope this review helps others to determine whether to buy Penetrex or not.  I bought it for my injured knee from gym. When I applied  it for the first time at night,  it did relief the pain but I couldn't sleep at all until 2-3 in the morning.  I also noticed that my skin became irritated suddenly after using it.I decided to try 3 more times. The same thing happened.  I couldn't sleep because my heart was beating so fast.  I am a health professional and have a normal blood pressure.  Arnica is one of the ingredients in Penetrex, which could result in tachycardia and high blood pressure according to the internet searches.  Amazon was nice enough to give me a full refund although it was a non-refundable product.
title: Adverse Reactions

author: Avi Sills
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: I'm a professional drummer/percussionist. And have chronic pain in my wrists, hands, neck and shoulders. I've tried many different products over the years and have found a few which have given me some relief. Early this year I tried Penetrex based on the positive reviews on amazon. I've been using it for just over 6 months and am absolulty impressed. My General pain level has gone down significantly, and my wrists and hands are much better.
title: Thank you Penetrex ! From a  previously sore drummer.

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2017
review_content: This is an excellent product. I order for my mother, who is 93, with severe arthritis pain in her shoulders and knees. We started using this on her simply by accident. She had been using a compounded formula that was supposed to exceed anything on the market. Of course it was a prescription.  She'd been on the prescribed lotion for two or three years. Ever so often the pharmacist would make a mistake in the compounding. This was one of those times. I'd ordered myself some of the Penetrex for fibromyalgia pain. I'd not yet opened the jar, so I took it to my mother. Her caregivers started using it on her while waiting for the new batch of lotion to be mixed. We had several days before I got the prescription back to her. In the next few days one of the caregivers mentioned to me that she felt like my mother had responded better to the Penetrex than the prescription lotion. She said her knee never once locked up on her while she was using the Penetrex, but had started back locking since they'd started back on the prescription lotion. Of course I told them to go back to the Penetrex. The prescription lotion is over a hundred dollars a bottle. Needless to say, Penetrex is not nearly that amount. Sorry this has been such a long review.
title: Penetrex REALLY works!!

author: Michael S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2019
review_content: Not sure how this received so many positive reviews. After using consistently for a 7 day trail (1 week) I finally had to accept that I had been ripped off. Nearly $20 USD spent on a “miracle cream” that does next to nothing for my lower back pain. I’ve trie dcountless topical creams for my back including iceyhot, biofreeze, capazine, emu oil and of course this product Pentrex. I am not a competitor or anyone special, just a consumer who feels frustrated at all the claims this product makes and spending my hard earned money just to realize this product is about as useful as mayonnaise for my lower back. Did not notice any difference whatsoever when using daily for 7 days. Not an immediate chilling or warming feeling, not a relief from back pain, just nothing. I would say Capazine has to be my #1 favorite working topical pain relief cream for lower back pain that I have tried thus far and even that isn’t some miracle cream; however, all of the claims about this product are false. Also Amazon does not allow you to return or replace this product for a refund so you must contact the seller directly. Very disappointed and dissatisfied by this product all together. Scent reminds me of an older optioned up grandmother. Smells of straight lotion with no distinct scent. Thank you.
title: Does Absolutely Nothing

author: Kenge Collison
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2016
review_content: I have been using Penetrex consistently for the past three years.Pros:The ingredients begin working to relieve pain very quickly. After rubbing in, you will feel substantial relief within a minute. I also like the fact that this is a topical treatment as opposed to taking medication with its side effects.Customer service from Biomax Health Products is excellent. Their representative will promptly address any issues you may have.Cons:It may be that my condition is worsening [I work at the computer and have pain in my fingers] but I have to use a lot of cream per application to obtain the full effect.Recommendations:After years of use, I have a couple recommendations to maximize the relief of your joint pain. I know that joint pain can be very disabling and negatively affect your ability to participate in and enjoy routine daily activities, such as taking a walk in the park, and so if any one reads this review, I hope that my experience can help you. Do use this product, but also incorporate a supplement of Glucosamine/Chondroitin and take this daily. In addition, do a little research on correct posture and do what you can to maintain proper posture when sitting at a desk, standing or walking. Lastly, revamp your workout to only low-impact exercises. May the Lord bless you.
title: My Review after years of use

author: J in Cali
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2018
review_content: I bought and used Penetrex for a pulled thigh muscle and returned it for a refund after several weeks due to it not being effective on the muscle pain.  That was six months ago and the skin on my thigh where I applied the cream is still numb.  I would not recommend this product based on my experience.  Over the counter NSAID's are more effective in my experience for a muscle pull.
title: Not great, left a skin numbness that persists after six months.

author: La poison
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2018
review_content: I’m not an easy believer. So many miracle remedy on the market, one more? I was in pain, a wrong movement on an arthritiic knee and I was unable to put my weight on this knee. Impossible for me to take anti-inflammtory drugs because of stomach problems. I went to an othopedic physician who after Xrays  proposed an infiltration. Before consulting the doctor I had heard a person to mention Penetrex as an amazing help for arthritis pain. This person looked as a reasonable person and I liked the way he was talking of it. At home I began to google the product then went on Amazon and read a lot of reviews going back and forth between the worse and the best and I decided finally to give it a try. While the specialist was offering an infiltration I decided to postpone it and wait to receive the small 2oz cream of Penetrex that I ordered. After 48H of massages several times a day and night I began to be relieved and able to sleep again. I was amazed and since I am a psychologist in my country (France) I began to think that the effect was due to something else, my rational side was to return to the fore and doubts were beginning to arise.That’s when the cold arrived where I live. A morning my driveway is totally frozen when I leave my house, I slip, fall and catch up on an elbow. Very quickly my elbow swollen, nothing broken but a sharp pain so I get back home and immediatly apply Arnica in gel then a generous amount of Penetrex cream by massaging delicately and does it for about 5 minutes till the cream penetrates. 48 Hours later the pain is reduce by about 80% and swelling disappears. One week after the fall I use my arm and elbow normally. I am convinced, this cream works. I bought recently 4 Oz and offer an other to my best friend. We are all completely stunned as looking at the ingredients how it is possible that it works so well! But it really works!
title: The miracle is in the pot...

author: GANNP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2016
review_content: This stuff really WORKS! I have bad scoliosis with chronic lower back muscle tightness, my "hump" I call it. The pic attached is an XR of my spine. I receive nerve blocks and nerve burns. I have tried ALL the prescribed external lotion, ointments, etc. Like Voltaren gel, lidocaine patches, bactroban, and even a special compound cream that only a few pharmacist in the US make. And believe me....this works better then all that other crap. Plus a heck of alot cheaper. Being an RN that works 12 hours shifts, I'm on my feet most of the day and bending, lifting, etc...not the best for my "broke back", I know. But I rub this on my "hump" first thing in the morning, let it dry before I even put on a shirt, then I'm good to go for the rest of the day. Not pain free but I can definitely tell when I forget to rub it on. BUY IT!....you won't be disappointed!  AAAAA++++++
title: THIS STUFF REALLY DOES WORK!

author: kswen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2017
review_content: I had a neck spasm that cause painful nerve irritation down my arm to my index finger and thumb. This also caused a bit of dulled sensation in those fingers as well as part of my hand. The pain was awful and I was willing to try anything, so I gave this a shot because it had such great reviews. I am so impressed with how much this has helped in such a short time.I rubbed some on my neck, upper arm, fore arm, and on the part of my hand with the dulled sensation and the pain reduced significantly. It's also healed my fingers and is gradually helping gain back the full sensation in my hand.I also tried it on my right hand after it got cramped from typing all day and again, the pain was reduced!The smell is pleasant, I haven't had any skin reactions (which I am susceptible to), and  a little goes a long way. What's especially interesting is that it doesn't have that cold/heat that other creams do. It just goes on and does it's magic.Highly recommend for inflammation and I would definitely but again.
title: Actually works

author: DPearl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2018
review_content: I tend to wake up in a lot of upper back pain in the middle of the night and early morning for some reason, and I'm at a loss to explain why it happens.  It comes and goes, which is classic symptoms of a term called ankylosing spondylitis.  After doing some research, I have symptoms of AS.  For periods of time I'll wake up at around 3 or 4 in the morning, sometimes sooner, and won't be able to lay back down comfortably.  So I was looking for a solution and realized that what I had was probably inflammation in my back.While I had been using penetrex for other arthritis symptoms, mostly for minor hip arthritis, my wife suggested she rub a lot on my upper back before going to sleep to see if it helps me get through the night without so much pain.  It helps TREMENDOUSLY!  I can finally manage to make it through my nights pain free.  I also bought a back reacher so I won't have to bug her every night.  I have no idea why the pain would come to begin with.  We have a new mattress, we rotate, and I've tried a ton of memory foam pillows, thinking by switching pillows it will help.  Nothing did until penetrex.  My wife knows best.  I am also using Turmeric now at her suggestion and I have noticed big time results.  Great for inflammation and I think a great treatment option for those suffering from anklylosing spondylitis or middle-of-the-night upper back pain.
title: Ankylosing Spondylitis treatment

author: Samantha Mae
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2020
review_content: I wish there was a way to give this a -* review. I used this for the pain in my back. I hoped it would give me even a LITTLE bit of relief because of the description and how similar products have been effective for me, but after using it AS DIRECTED with NO relief at all I'm more than disappointed because I was under the impression that if it didn't work, they would accept a return because it said fulfilled by Amazon. So they're falsely advertising by posting those customers reviews that they will "happily refund your money" because theres no option for that and now I can't get my money back and have a useless product. I DO NOT recommend this to anyone.
title: Warning: False advertising that you get a refund if you're not happy with it!

author: Mayra Cornejo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2019
review_content: I suffered recently of leg and foot pain. It was severe, couldn't sleep, so I massaged the Penetrex cream and it took about 10 mins to start feeling the relieve and than i fell asleep, mind you, I had taken 2 pain and sleeping pills prior and it didn't work so this cream did a wonderful job!! i will buy it again, I highly recommend it!!
title: works great

author: Retired Olde Farte
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2019
review_content: I have chronic pain from osteoarthritis in my wrists, ankles, and feet.  I got rid of some pain by discarding the New Balance shoes recommended by doctors and wearing Sketchers (thanks Tony Romo commercials!) but have not found a solution for the joints other than daily ibuprofen (which can have side effects over time).  Tried a product withCBD oil that promised "No Pain".  Sorry- didn't do a thing for me.  Then someone put me onto Veterinary Liniment gel, which works GREAT, but it smells awful - you smell like a turpentine factory.  So I decided to try Penetrex.  It DOES relieve the pain somewhat - maybe 50-60% - but it does not seem to last more than a couple of hours.  So I've been using Penetrex on my wrists and Liniment on my ankles, where the odor is not  so distracting and overwhelming.  I'm still looking for the ideal gel or ointment and haven't found it, but this product certainly helps reduce the need for multiple daily doses of ibuprofen.
title: It Works on Osteoarthritis of Smaller Joints....Sort of...

author: Sue Blankenship
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2017
review_content: Have used 2-3 times a day for a week and kind of diaappointed.  Read reviews and propel raved as they had severe pain and how much it helped.  I guess my pain is severe++ as I found very little results.  Going to give another week and probably will return.
title: Not for severe pain in lower back

author: F. Buffa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2017
review_content: I have UCTD (Undifferentiated connective tissue disease) which gives me quite a few annoying symptoms.  My main problem being fibromyalgia and arthritis. I have a toddler and she doesn't understand mommy's in pain, so I have to push through.  This cream has helped me alot as I don't have to swallow harmful pills on a constant basis.  It doesn't burn like others have nor does it have a smell that makes me feel like my grandpa.  I wish the affects lasted longer but as long as I remember to use it first thing in the AM it lasts about 8hrs before I want or need to reapply to certain areas.  I plan to purchase a few more for my mom and grandmother for Xmas.This $20 jar (for me) is worth it,  the less pills I have to take the better I feel and the longer I'll live.  A little goes a long way so don't be heavy fingered,  it's not necessary to slather it on.
title: I have fibromyalgia and it works for me.

author: Kendrick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2019
review_content: The ONLY pain cream I use and I’ve tried probably about 20 including prescription pain creams!I have always had back issues and have 4 screws in my lower back/hips that even though are “fixed” still cause me a lot of pain especially when there’s a change in atmosphere like a storm rolling in! I don’t like mentholated creams as I hate getting it on my hands since even though I wash and wash and wash it still doesn’t come off enough for me to change out my contacts and that BURNS! I also use a heating pad regularly and mentholated creams plus heating pads are pretty content productive! I have been using this cream for years now and recommend it whenever I can! It is the only cream that goes deep enough to help my bone pain and rubs in seamlessly without leaving a greasy feel! I’ve also used the roll on version and that seems to make application easy and also helps roll out a little of my tight muscles while applying so it’s a win win! I use this on my back, hips, outer hip (bursitis) and even my hands sometimes to help with arthritis pain! I can’t take many nsaids so I really believe the arnica in it helps with my constant inflammation!
title: You can’t go wrong, been using for years and always satisfied!

author: S. LaMartina
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2018
review_content: I don’t really see what the hype is about. First off, this container is super small and the directions say, apply liberally and for at least 7-10 days to see the effects. Ummm this container is too small and is not gonna last very long and for $19 ... I expect better results. I’m a PT and I’ll use Biofreeze any day of the week over this stuff. I prefer feeling immediate relief and the coolness of the biofreeze vs. this cream. And on top of everything, the returns process is not as easy as they say. You can’t return it through Amazon which is usually very easy. I had to call, then wait for them to email me instructions and now I have to package it back up and pay to send it back and then they will send me a check for the refund???  Who sends checks anymore?? I want the refund to my credit card that I paid for it on!!! Too complicated!!!! It’s almost like they are trying to make you so frustrated that you just say forget it and not return it and just eat the money you spent! Not happy! Don’t buy! Get a 32oz of Biofreeze instead and save yourself some hassle
title: Not worth the price and returning it is a HUGE hassle!

author: Me
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2020
review_content: I trained for years in Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu... A sport focused on joint locks, knee bars, DEEP tissue/ligament damage.Bengay/Tiger balm are quick fixes. This is not a "put it on, feel better" remedy. This is a "if you have more severe damage, apply it for a few weeks, and it'll help stuff the others could never touch" solution.I've had a dislocated shoulder, tear in my knee, severe tennis elbow to where I thought I'd need surgery, injuries where I couldn't sleep well for months. Penetrex became my fountain of youth. It healed deep injuries I thought would require surgery.Again, this is NOT a "sore muscles/quick fix" balm. You're not going to feel it right away. It can take weeks, or longer for deeper injuries. This is for DEEP ligament/tissue damage, and it works.Now, if you have injuries/tears that absolutely require surgery, no, it's not magical. But if you have ligament damage that might be able to heal on its own, over time? This is GOLD.Its been around for decades, and I can't believe it doesn't get more publicity.My sport was rough enough, topical stuff like Ben Gay was worthless for my injuries as the pain/damage was too deep.Penetrex though?It's gotten me past a few injuries I really thought I might need surgery on.Again, NOT a quick fix for minor pain, he helps heal deeper ligament/tissue injuries over a few weeks or months. But I'm talking INJURIES that might not heal on their own.I love this stuff. If you have muscle pain, go for topical. If you're an have deeper ligament/tissue damage, true damage, not just sore muscles... give this a try. I've never found anything that even comes close, and I'm still not sure how it works so well. All I know,  for me, it's saved me from a few possible surgeries.
title: This WORKS for deep ligament pain, including tennis elbow!

author: Tammy G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2019
review_content: When you're in pain and willing to try anything you become hopefully optimistic.  I just so happened to be shopping for a should support for chronic tendinitis.  Aftera shot of cortisone for bursitis in the shoulder I was still left with this tendinitis in the bicep that would limit my work outs and would really flare up with certain motions of my arm.When I went to purchase the shoulder support there's the OTHERS ALSO PURCHASED + I saw Penetrex. Having over 26K reviews!?! I though what the heck, I'll see if it works.I know it sounds silly but I literally noticed a difference after the first use.  My daughter was suffering with lower back pain due to holding her new baby all the time.  She tried it and same thing, she felt better.I'm not cured, but I do notice a significant difference about 20-30 minutes after applying to my shoulder/arm.  I used this morning before my work out, I noted that after my work out my shoulder/bicep felt really good.I know some have complained about the size of the jar, I can't imagine using the entire jar in a month.  I'm only applying maybe 1/4 of a teaspoon size at a time. If you're in pain and it gives you even some releif the $20 is well worth it (hello $20 for pain relief?).  The odor isn't as medicinal as icy hot or other creams.  Nice thick cream rubs in easily.I now carry it in my purse so I don't forget to use it.  I love that they are local here in San Diego.
title: You might want to give this a try!  Shoulder Tendinitis Issue

author: Danny
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2017
review_content: I have a Herniated disc L4 L5 which is causing me a lot of sciatic pain. The pain runs from my right glute all the way down my leg. I rub this cream generously all over the effected area and I get no relief. Granted my condition is serious and I can't really blame the cream. I wrote this review to let others who have this kind of pain know that this is not a miricle cream unfortunately. :(
title: I have a Herniated disc L4 L5 which is causing ...

author: Kay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2017
review_content: 2 years of heel and ankle pain and multiple trips to podiatrist. Dx heel spur and achilles tendonosis. Physical therapy failed to give relief. Multiple supports tried. All to no avail and im looking at surgery.So i decided to try topical treatment. Ive done everything else. Why not?USED THIS AS DIRECTED THIS STUFF WORKS!!!!Holy cow! I can walk w no limp!. No pain waking me at night....i can get up in the morning without tendon stretches! This after one week of massaging penetrex in 4x daily.I get nothing from the manufacturer or amazon, and ONLY opportunity to help someone else.MAY BE A LITTLE PRICEY BUT CHEAPER THAN COPAY FOR DR VISIT.USE THIS.
title: IT WORKS LIKE IT SAYS....

author: AG
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2017
review_content: I have received the package and have not tried the product yet, but I am going to give it one star over the deceiving image on amazon. The image shows a very big container compare to the fingers/hand above it. Now that the packag is really small and just 2 ounces.
title: Such a small container!

author: P. Miller
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2020
review_content: There is NOTHING I dislike about this pain relieving cream.  It is amazing!  use it for arthritis pain, muscle soreness, back pain, pretty much anything that effects the outside of my body or muscular, strains, even to help a broken wrist heal faster with less pain.  I have been using Penetrex for somewhere around 8-10 years. ( I wish it could help my memory!)  My Rheumatologist had prescribed a cream for my arthritis pain and osteoarthritis pain which contained an NSAID.  I did not want to use any pain relievers which contained NSAIDs.  And I much prefer natural plant ingredients to anything pharmaceutical I was so excited when I first tried this product and found that it worked so much better, and without an ingredient which could harm my liver or kidneys in the long run.  I have continued using this cream and sometimes hand out little samples to friends or relatives who could benefit from it.  Check it out I promise that you won't be sorry.  Happy Healing! :)
title: Amazing relief which covers just about everything external (sorry you cannot eat it)

author: Mistress Collette
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2020
review_content: I have a condition where my connective tissue is being destroyed by my body. I was looking for something to help me through the severe pain of pinched nerves, as I'm not a fan of being incapacitated by expensive prescription drugs all the time, wasting days in emergency rooms, being in too much pain to live, nor do I like the heart and kidney problems that come from over exposure to medicines. Around 2 years ago I got frustrated and came to Amazon to look for help. Here I found dozens of highly recommended creams. Given how much my drugs already cost me, and how much of my life I had already lost hoping for solutions, I figured that it was worth the money to try a whole bunch of the options and see what worked so I purchased almost three dozen of the top rated topical creams.I did lots of comparison tests on all the creams I received and soon threw away all but around 1/2 a dozen of the creams. Three of the creams worked on nerve pain about as well as Penetrex, however, I am vegetarian, and they were not. One of the products worked just a little less well, but was in the same price range. One of the products, the cheapest, I now get to apply to my dog, for her wobblers condition, as that product comes with a thin gel option. That product may have been the cheapest, but it was also the weakest of the products that actually seem to work at all. But Penetrex REALLY works!I later found out that I have a friend with a different condition from mine that has caused her disks to degenerate. She could barely walk from the nerve pain, and spent most of her life on super high levels of drugs that barely cut the pain. I gave her a tub of Penetrex. One month later I ran into her and she grabbed me and hugged me, crying. Apparently, Penetrex was helping her so much that she was actually able to ease off a lot of her pain killers and was able to start going on daily walks; something she hadn't been able to do in over 20 years!Interestingly enough, not only does Penetrex work well for muscle and nerve pain, but it cuts bone pain to nothing. Kinda in a scary good way...I had a friend who broke some of the bones in her foot, and didn't go to the doctor's until she had been walking on them for 4 months. Let's just say that the pain was pretty bad, and the bones were very messed up. I gave her a jar of Penetrex to help her sleep, as the doctors were still hopeful that she might not need surgery... She used the Penetrex cream and was so pain free that one day she didn't wash it off before going into work. She walked on her broken foot for an entire day and felt no pain because of the Penetrex. Lets just say that she eventually had to have the bones in her feet pinned, however, the Penetrex allowed her to sleep pain free, and recover. But she did remember to wash it off every morning after that one time...A different friend broke her leg in a weird spiral fracture that wasn't healing well and was extremely painful. I called her to check on her a week after she broke her leg. She was in very bad shape as the pain had been so bad she could barely sleep all week, and the pain pills the doctor sent her home with weren't helping at all. I was able to send a jar of Penetrex to her, and soon got a phone call from her, crying and thanking me for the Penetrex, and how much help it was. Apparently she slept for almost 2 days solid, as soon as the Penetrex cream started working. Like my friend with the broken foot, however, one day she forgot to wash the cream off her leg, and she spent the entire day blissfully puttering around the house, in no pain (forgetting to put on her removable brace/cast). However, after she took a shower, she realized the enormity of her mistake, as she had caused a lot of damage to her broken bone by walking on it all day. She didn't repeat that mistake again, and was very cautious about when she had the cream on ever after that.I later gave some to a friend who was having a lot of rib pain. He had tripped and fallen onto a small stump, where he broke 3 ribs in multiple places. he couldn't even breath or drive because of the pain, and sleeping wasn't happening. With Penetrex, he was able to sleep pain free, and recovered quickly.Honestly, although I don't know for certain, I am betting that Penetrex is every parent's dream for kids with growing pains in their legs, too. I'll report back, if I end up sharing it with anyone in that situation.The important things to know about applying Penetrex cream:- Apply an amount equivalent to a heavy coating of sunscreen.- The cream will start working immediately, but takes around 20 minutes to achieve maximum effect.- It takes about 20 minutes for the cream to absorb into your skin. Wait that full amount of time before attempting to apply another coat if you want greater relief. You can apply as many coats as needed to do the job.- Each application, when applied after the prior layer has fully absorbed, will have a cumulative effect. (If you don't wait, applying another coating to a wet coating doesn't seem to actually do more good than just applying one coating...)- If you apply a coating and the cream doesn't help much, then Penetrex is either the wrong product for the type of pain you are in, or you are not actually applying the cream at the source of your pain. (e.g., for my tennis elbow, applying Penetrex to my elbow makes my brain happy because my brain rationalizes that that's where the pain is coming from, however, it does nothing to reduce the pain. I have to apply the cream to my neck and shoulders, as that's where the pinched nerve is. When applied to my neck and shoulders, then the Penetrex cuts down on the pain from the tennis elbo. Sadly, although it helps some with the tennis elbo pain, it is definitely not the correct product for the job, as no amount of coatings is enough to actually stop the pain.)So, yes, I would and do HIGHLY recommend Penetrex. I have recommended it to at least 100 people over the 2 years since I discovered it! I also recommend it to everyone as a part of your standard first aid kit. Penetrex really has been a godsend for me and so many of my friends!
title: A Godsend!

author: deborah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2015
review_content: This is my second order and there will be more. I have severe Plantar Fasciitis. Massaging this into the heel and sides of my foot twice a day honestly helps - A LOT!  My first jar, I dove in the first couple weeks, unimpressed other than it made my foot/heel feel really great while I was deep massaging.  I did not feel, after a week or two, that it was doing remarkable things so I kind of stopped using it.  My foot would bring such horrid pain I would reach for Penetrex again, once in a while. I was down to half a jar and started with some of the worse pain I'd had in the 8 months I've had Plantar.  I followed the direction religiously.  Within 5 days the unbearable pain was diminished, and day by day it gets a bit better.  You know, when all else fails, --READ THE DIRECTIONS and follow them! The manufacturers know their product.  3 to 4 times a day for a week or a week or so then as needed (I do it daily, I dare not mess up again).  It is worth the try, they do have a 100% guarantee so go for it!
title: Found out this stuff really DOES make a difference.

author: Scott S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2020
review_content: I had high hopes but this offered no perceivable muscle and joint pain relief after using on lower back and shoulders 3-4 times daily for 5 days.I’ve tried numerous products on the market and this was a major disappointment for sure. My wife also tried it for muscle and joint pain, without me commenting that I felt not relief she said “this stuff doesn’t do anything”.On a positive - it does not have a strong odor like other products but those products seems to work better. Salonpas patches have worked great for us for years! Downside is they have a strong menthol order.
title: Disappointed. No relief after 5 days.

author: Seventh-777
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2017
review_content: I bought this for my 69 year old father who has RA and PHT. Unfortunately it did nothing for swelling from either - he tried it on his hands (RA) and on swollen ankles from PHT. He likened it a bit to Ben Gay or similar products, but did not get any real relief from it whatsoever.I had high hopes based on the reviews but the product simply didn't do anything that it says it does for my father.
title: Does not work for Rheumatoid arthritis or swelling from hypertension.

author: Nancy Loomis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2021
review_content: I'm right-handed and broke my right wrist late Spring 2021. After surgery and after having support removed, I tried  various pain relieving creams and then also used a lidocaine spray for pain/itch relief and antibacterial properties as the wound healed.  I also went through several months of physical hand therapy to get back my wrist flexibility and finger flexibility and strength which had been affected by the wrist break too. I also have basal thumb joint arthritis in both hands, but am right handed so the break at my wrist made the arthritis there more painful.I tried the the blue stuff...it was ok and the former prescription V gel and while that gave some relief, it had such a strong perfume-like fragrance that I didn't like, plus the use directions warn that you shouldn't use it more  than 21 days in a row...and it does have some very strong ingredients that get into your bloodstream and that concerned me too.  However, from another reviewer I'm reading that the MSM in Penetrex also gets into your bloodstream and that for some this causes some bad side effects.  Fortunately, I haven't experienced those side effects.  I use Penetrex twice a day and find it really does gives me relief from the mild but ongoing pain from the break (that strangely caused some sensitivity and skin irritation on my forearm too) and it also helps relieve a lot of the arthritic pain in both thumb joints.  It has virtually no odor and seems to absorb quickly.  I've come to rely on it and will likely continue purchasing it for the foreseeable future.
title: Great With Regular Use

author: L. Hemme
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2021
review_content: My husband drives a truck for a living and about 4 mo. ago he came in from the garage and went straight to bed, he was convinced he had kidney stones again. Spent two weeks in bed waiting to see urologist only to be told, even the remaining stones after the last surgery were gone (thank you lemon juice and olive oil). The doctor suggested it sounded like he was having sciatica issues and thought a chiropractor or orthopedic would better serve him. We made an immediate appointment with a chiropractor the next day, he felt great when he came home but the minute he was back driving the truck, he was in severe pain, he continued to see the chiropractor for about 6 weeks and same thing so we then decided to try acupuncture, basically the same results. All this time my husband has practically crawled out of the truck every day, coming home and going straight to bed, he is naturally thin and over this time period lost over twenty lb. due to loss of appetite and occasional vomiting from pain, I was actually convinced I was going to have to get a class A license myself so I could at least fill in for him a couple days a week because I knew he could not continue like this much longer and he confirmed this 21 days ago telling me he was ready to give up, he had had enough. Mind you between all of this, he has been doing the recommended exercises, using a inversion table, using all kinds of ointments, back braces, gel cushion, hot baths, pain patches, insoles, pillow between legs while sleeping and a severe dependency on Excedrin Ex twenty plus a day. So yesterday I got on Amazon and started looking for anything else to try, I started reading reviews (thank you Amazon community I would never have found this without you), I was able to get it same day and I ordered this along with Penetrex Joint & Muscle Therapy and completely blown away, I called him this morning to see how he was feeling, he had been in the truck at least 3 hours already and free of pain. I can't recommend this thing enough, he made me promise to write a review hoping it might help someone else, I hope it does!******************all the way! I think I will even order one for myself as I have been suffering from sciatica issues myself off and on now for at least 5 yr myself, I am a believer! I'm lazy, I copied this from the review about the brace but the combination of the two completely turned things around, I do want to add that my husband has had terrible pain in his hands for years, his fingers are actually bending and twisting from degenerative bone loss? When my husband put the cream on his back this morning, he also rubbed the cream into his hands and he said he was without pain in his hands for over 5 hours, looks like we will never be without this stuff ever again.
title: This item along with the Hip Brace - Sciatica Pain Relief Brace saved a life!

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2019
review_content: Review of 2oz from 2015:Great product. Will keep buying. Unable to take NSAIDs by mouth because they affect my kidneys but amazingly enough, Penetrex is very effective. As an MD, I also have been recommending it to my patients in a similar predicament or who prefer the holistic route.2019 Updated review—4oz and 4oz 3 pk:I have continued to use this product faithfully for 4 years. I was subsequently diagnosed with Primary Progressive Multiple Sclerosis in October of 2016. I have had almost continuous episodes of tendinitis in various parts of my lower extremities since 2014 December. The only constant has been Penetrex. I have not been without it a day since. Hamstring tendinitis. Tendinitis in buttock muscles. IT Band Syndrome. Hubby’s Plantar Fasciitis. Knee pain and swelling. Quadriceps. Adductors. I am so prone to overuse injury with less than normal activity, being disabled. I can not go one day without Penetrex. I cannot leave town without Penetrex.Go get yours. My patients love it too. ❤️

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2020
review_content: At 18 I crashed my motorcycle going uphill on a steep dirt hill and landed directly on my head wearing a crash helmet. I went unconscious for a few seconds. Or in the last twenty years when working long hours on my computer.Now 72 I have been diagnosed with a form of arthritis. So I took up riding an electric bike (still putting in a lot of peddling effort). But, like with my R/c gliders I have to continually have my neck tilted way back to look ahead. This has often caused so much neck pain I couldn't continue to ride. And most menthol based products didn't work to take away my pain either during my ride or afterwards. But PENETREX does. An amazing product. Highly recommended

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2016
review_content: I started using Penetrex when I was desperate for relief from Plantar Fasciitis. The Penetrex doesn't fully absorb because I put A LOT on my feet, and it is a bit greasy when applied that way. It doesn't have an odor, doesn't stain, and feels neither cool nor hot when applied. author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2021
review_content: This stuff containsDMSO! DMSO is a known liver carcinogen.  It has two purposes 1) in a very controlled sterile setting in can be used to deliver medications through the skin.  2) Cleaning solvent with warning that hazemat suit should be worn.  Any contaminates on your skin or in the cream will be absorbed by the skin.  I had a family member who never drank and with no history of liver issues be diagnosed with end stage liver cancer after using DMSO for years.  She was dead within 3 months of her diagnosis.  Any relief is not worth the risk. I tried to return this Stuff when I realized what was in it but was denied a refund.  Will have to figure out how to dispose of it safely.
title: Contains DMSO!  DMSO is known to cause liver damage.
