date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2019
review_content: I have chemo induced peripheral neuropathy in my hands. The pain is symmetrical in both hands and it moves back and forth between joint pain and nerve pain just below the skin. My middle fingers are numb and so is the tip of my right hand index finger. I have no joint or muscle  stiffness. It's weird and painful especially in the wee hours of the morning. I followed the instructions with the Penetrex and did not get any sort of relief. I tried a generic 4% lidocaine cream and found that it worked almost immediately.  .... Sorry Penetrex! The lidocaine cream is far cheaper and more effective for me.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2018
review_content: I received an e-mail asking me to write a review.  I'm sorry to report that this cream did not help my situation. I have Fibromyalgia and Degenerative Disc disease. review_content: I was a skeptic. I have tried other products such as Biofreeze and IcyHot which didn't work. Penetrex delivers relief immediately. date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2021
review_content: This cream has been a life saver, truly! I was very sick with COVID back in June 2020. After my symptoms finally started going away I noticed I was having a lot of pain in my knee. It very quickly got very painful. I developed plantar fasciitis to both feet, pain and swelling to all of my toes (and feet, and ankles), and my hands, first the left and then the right. I couldn't stand to bear weight on my feet. I have orthotic insoles, wear compression stockings every day, wear plantar fasciitis splints to sleep in. I have a copper lined compression sleeve for my knee and gloves for both hands. I'm eating NSAIDS like they're skittles.Nothing I have done has even compared to the relief I get from this cream. author: Dee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2016
review_content: The Penetrex cream has been really helpful to me. I have been using it for several months and the results have been great. Someone mentioned using it together with the Penetrex cream and having good results.I was desperate for change and ordered my first jar. I used it for about two weeks, applying it almost hourly at first trying to keep the pain in check. After a few days I began to feel the difference. Since then I have been using it in conjunction with massage and the infar red treatments.Even when I don't have time for the other treatments, the Penetrex cream is part of my daily routine. The swelling in my feet and ankles as well as the pain has been significantly reduced.  My wrist is also much better and does not throb constantly. This I attribute largely to the regular use of this cream which I massage in at least twice daily to manage the pain.I have shared it with relatives and family members who have purchased their own and used it with great results and I would highly recommend this product to anyone looking for relief form inflammation and the resulting pain, especially in the joints.So far I intend to continue using the Penetrex cream to help manage my pain and discomfort

review_content: I am in my mid-70's, doctors say I have lots of arthritis (hands,shoulders, back,knees, etc)  I have been over active with years of yard work, raising family, computers, cleaning, lifting...etc. so my joints have started reminding me this is "pay-back"  for not being more gentle with work habits.My hands have been the most painful..(they are used for EVERYTHING!) author: Scotty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2021
review_content: Still have pain and i wasn't sure why. I should have done my due diligence. I just saw a bunch of stars and thought it had to work :( Here are the red flags to let you know this is fake.1) Website says "use in conjunction with complementary therapies such as heating pads".  - A real product tells you not to do that because heating will accelerate the rate at which your skin absorbs it. Real products want it absorbed slowly otherwise you might damage your skin.2) The active ingredient is commonly used for inflammation but no there is no scientific evidence to support it. In other words it's an old wives' tale.3) Website says apply for 7 - 10 days and massage it; which is coincidently the amount of time it takes for your body to do enough repair that pain goes away; unless you do something to inflame the injury.4) Placebo effect is real. Pain is all in the head and if you believe this will work, you'll likely feel less pain. Unfortunately placebo's don't work on everyone equally and I need something better.
title: Hippie Medicine

author: dostoevsky
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2021
review_content: I am an sceptic when it comes to medications.  Especially non FDA approved ones.  I have tried many number of supplements and could not testify that any of them made a noticeable difference.  I just stopped spending on them.  Most of them have great reviews and a lot of people are saying good things about them.  I am just not one them, not for and not against.But, this is different.  I have had tightness under my thigh for many years.  Some call it wallet syndrome, and medically called Piriformis syndrome.  In recent months, in addition to the tightness, I have had numbness and pain from the right side of my hip to my knee,  my crus, and ankle.I made an appointment to see an orthopedist.  After the X-rays, I was told that my hip is ok.  Doctor wrote a prescription for topical cream (Pennsaid, $2500.00), super strong Ibuprofen, physical therapy, and to see the Spine team (passing new customer to colleagues!!).I checked the Pennsaid on my phone and noticed that it included a ton of warnings, especially, not to use it while taking Ibuprofen.  I decided not to get any of them and instead get the over the counter version of Diclofenac from Walmart for around $11.  Meanwhile, while I was checking Amazon for Voltran I noticed Penetrex and that was my lucky day indeed.  I ordered the cream thinking the worst is just losing $20.I got it the next day and I followed the instruction closely. Now is almost 6 days and I have noticed a BIG difference in my condition. author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2017
review_content: I have chronic lower back pain, but occasionally it gets extremely painful (to the point where I occasionally scream when trying to stand, etc.). Penetrex is really the only topical cream I've tried that made a difference in my back pain. It's not magical - if i'm DEFCON 1 mode, the pain doesn't completely disappear, but it becomes much more manageable and I am at least a functional person then. And you still need to do the other normal things (TENS, physical therapy, etc.), too. But I've struggled with back pain for so long and tried so many things - I really feel it's the most effective topical cream available, OTC or otherwise.If my back is only slightly sore, it does seem to completely remove the pain or at least make it much more manageable. I've tried lidocaine 4%, and that works in a different way, for a shorter length of time, and doesn't help as much as Penetrex when my back is in DEFCON 1 mode. I've tried compounded creams, and quite frankly, without disparaging the entire compounding industry, they're being used as profit makers for doctors (when they "refer" you to a special pharmacy), and some of the ingredients they use just don't work transdermally - you can research it yourself.Penetrex publishes the ingredients online, in great detail, which I like, and they stand behind it -- I was going through tub after tub a few years ago and one came in with a bad seal and it looked kind of funny and they overnighted a replacement to me.I realize it's not cheap, but it's one of the best tools in my "bad back" toolbox - you should always have some around, and if you're in pain, it's worth a try - I'm pretty sure they will refund your money if it doesn't help. And it's less expensive than compounding pharmacy creams I've tried, and for me, and my particular problem, it really works very well.
title: Penetrex really works well for my chronic lower back pain

author: El
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2016
review_content: I am in my 60s. For at least 5 years now, I've had bouts of pain in my hips that radiated down my thighs,  more severe recently. I imagine it's arthritis. I always walk and exercise regardless, but it had gotten so bad that I could scarcely concentrate on anything else. I used to consider Advil a miracle drug, but after a time it made my stomach crampy, and as I had known a woman who wound up with internal bleeding after taking NSAIDs for years, I thought I should switch to Tytlenol, which helps but does nothing for inflammation.I was wondering if there might be an NSAID cream I could try, and in searching Amazon I came across the Penetrex reviews, which seemed detailed enough to be credible, and ordered a 2-ounce jar. I was in something of a panic. I am in the music business and have quite an active late-blooming career, and the thought of going down the hip-replacement road prior to age 70 was alarming.I used a small amount of Penetrex four times a day. After a few days I felt a bit less achy, though still with some flare-ups, e.g., my hip giving out painfully when I was climbing stairs. After two weeks, almost having gone through the 2-oz jar, I realized I was walking to the park with virtually no discomfort. It was incredible. I ordered the larger jar, which I am continuing to use several times a day for now. I am not completely free of pain, but so much better that when I got the usual follow-up email from the seller I thought I should write a review.I always take the possibility of a placebo effect into account, but I think this stuff works. If you’d like to do some research, look on PubMed for clinical trials studying the benefits of arnica, the primary ingredient in Penetrex. BTW, I also lost 2-3 pounds, which according to what I’ve read, is the equivalent of 10 pounds less stress on the joints (my cat weighs 10, which brought that concept home to me). Maybe a combination of the two things.
title: Relief

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2017
review_content: After years of suffering with neck pain and its accompanying debilitating headaches which did not respond to the usual non prescription pain medications including pills and common topical pain relief ointments, I underwent radio frequency ablation with a spinal specialist. I had tried a homeopathic cream ordered from Amazon that gave me some relief and was about to reorder when I came across Penetrex with its 17,000 outstanding reviews and decided to give it a try. Truly amazing product. I used as directed 3 times a day at first and noticed considerable relief right away. I still have some better days than others, but I have found that with consistent use, I have more better days than not and can hopefully avoid another injection. I plan on making this a permanent part of my pain treatment. An interesting fact about Arnica, one of its ingredients--my husband a retired physician and graduate pharmacist remembered Arnica from his pharmacy days. He said it is a very old topical remedy for relieving pain. Who knew!!! Perhaps some of the old remedies still work best.

author: linda reynolds
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2020
review_content: I have herniated discs in my back, plus stenosis and arthritis in my spine. Neck pain, lower back pain plus my knees are a mess. I was diagnosed with subluxating patella in my teens both knees (basically partially dislocated kneecaps) and had to give up all my beloved sports at 17 (baseball, basketball, running, skiiing etc) All I could do was walk on a flat surface and swim). This was a long time ago. They did a 10 hour reconstructive surgery on my left knee--and it was a disaster. Thank God I did not let them touch my other knee.Because over the years I have fallen and re-injured both knees, plus the passage of time has done a job on them. But the one they operated on has caused ten times more pain and lack of mobility. AND top orthopedic surgeons tell me I am not a candidate for knee replacement on THAT knee because my prior surgery made it not an option (it turns out it is very controversial; I was an experimental subject really, and it was problematic--it is so infamous that they are delighted to look at it and study the films and tell their colleagues they saw one up close 30 years later!) So I am in pain frequently. I have done the pain meds route (Advil, Tylenol, Tumeric, Gabapentin, lyrica, muscle relaxants, magnesium, opioids) They all have well known side effects--I have an ulcer now so NSAIDs are not an option), and I do not like being tired, and I will still use natural supplements---esp., Magnesium, Tumeric aka Curcumin, MSM,) and an occasional pain med, RICE and an infra red lamp--all provided various degrees of relief but  I was so happy to be introduced to Penetrex. A good friend--a drummer--with tendonitis in wrist and shoulder swore by it. I of course had used ICE (the cream) and tiger balm etc. Noting compared to Penetrex. A mild smell, no burning or tingling, and it provides true relief. I use it whenever I have pain also in my wrists, shoulder--getting older so pain is a common part of my life now. I tell everybody I know. "If you have pain--try Penetrex. It works!" Seriously.  Thank you!!

author: Jenny O.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2019
review_content: I vowed never to write a review on Amazon ever again, because the naysayers just like to pick you apart, but I felt compelled to review Penetrex because it's been amazing for me.  I was diagnosed with large defects in the cartilage in both knees 2 years ago at the age of 47.  I'm too young for knee replacement, but was told by my orthopedic specialist that I had to suffer through the pain until I was old enough.  I was put on Celebrex for my issues, but I'm not a fan of taking an anti-inflammatory daily for the rest of my life.  A friend recommended using Arnica creams to help with the pain.  I tried one popular brand, and had some improvement, but still found myself needing that Celebrex.  Penetrex came up as "suggested for me" on Amazon, it was on deal of the day, so I thought I'd give it a try.  I liked that it had MSM in it, which is proven to decrease inflammation.  Oral MSM made me feel better, but also broke me out in hives, so I thought I'd try the topical version.All I can say is I am happy I did!  Penetrex soothes my achy joints, and even helped when I wrenched my lower back.  I put it on every night before bed, when my knees ache the most, and during the day if needed.  If I didn't experience the relief of the pain and inflammation I would not believe it.  It works.  I make sure to massage it in until the cream is absorbed which makes a difference.  The ache subsides; my knees feel better.  I re-apply during the day as I need, and every time I can feel the ache lessen.The product has a very light scent, which is an added bonus.  I'm on my 4th jar of the stuff and I've noticed not change in the effectiveness.  I'm a believer.  Thanks Penetrex!

author: jake
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2021
review_content: I bought this because I saw the "Inflammation Formula" on the side and because I can't really use anti-inflammatory medications due to their stomach related side effects. author: Abigail Geffen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2021
review_content: ok, here we go!  I have 20 yrs of auto-immune: PSA, as well was a dancer for 20 yrs, and then runner, crazy yoga doer, gym freak, etc... and many repetitive injuries, as in hundreds... not exaggerating.  I'm 53 now, and have tendinitis and tendinosis from neck to toe... 2 frozen shoulders in 3 years... hand like a sauce for nine months... couldn't drive, surgeries to remove calcified tissue in my achilies tendon and gastroc muscle... the list goes on for days.  Extreme pain even on several different biologics over the years. And have been somewhat disabled again, for 20 yrs.  I don't mean I can't run or do a down dog... I can't do any athletics exept stationary bike (with pain).  I mean just daily living stuff.  Of course this stuff hasn't been a magic cure and all of the sudden I'm an athlete again.  That can't ever happen.  BUT, this stuff is the real deal!!!  It works for me not only to relieve pain but to calm inflammation.  This is NOT a placebo effect.  I have already tried 10 different topicals, PT for yrs on and off, osteopathy, supplements, pain meditation for yrs. and way more.  It works. Period!!  I imagine it probably can't work for everyone, but if it can work for me???  There has to be something to it.  Maybe some of the negative reviews are because of an expectation that is a little high.  Sure, it is annoying to put on 3 times a day or so, but I do it, and ALL over my body.  It takes about 15 min. for me.  Practically a part time job. ok, so what?  It is by far better then any other topical.  Lasts longer and feels like it actually heals to some degree, and my stuff isn't all that healable :(. Please try this!  Be realistic with expectations, apply generously, and I believe you absolutely will get result for any soft tissue, even ligaments.  btw, I receive nothing for this review, except hopefully helping someone else with real pain!!!

author: Jerrell P.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2019
review_content: First off, I do not normally write reviews on products, but I am making an exception for this product. I will make this short and sweet by saying that this product works. At an older age, joints are more sensitive to the pounding on the courts.I also bought some for my mom's sciatic nerve pain in her back and she could not praise this stuff enough! Thank you for providing a good product that can help some many people deal with the daily pains of life. If your pain is more severe than this cream can handle, you have a more serious underlying condition. Like this would not cure my Arthritis pain in my AC Joint. author: Sbateman13
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2020
review_content: Was skeptical at first, now I can't live without it! Very satisfied repeat customer. Non-greasy, absorbs quickly, works quickly! I am extremely sensitive to fragrances and I will say that while this definitely has a hint of menthol-y odor comparable to all muscle rub OTC products, it is much milder and fades fairly quickly. Unlike other such products (which honestly aren't even in the same class as Penetrex), I don't hesitate to apply it before leaving the house. No one is likely to notice the scent unless they're directly sniffing the application site.As a mom of 2 young children who suffers from chronic pain (due to a variety of physical conditions and previous injuries), I need something that helps reduce my pain without lasting negative side effects, such as fatigue.This cream really works. Honestly, compared to other pain creams, it's like the difference between a prescription and an OTC product. As stated on the label, when you first start using it you should apply it more liberally. After that initial period, however, you will discover increased results with fewer applications. It's truly amazing.Whenever I experience "break through" pain, I apply this, and within an hour or so I generally experience enough relief to avoid having to turn to pain medications. Occasionally, when my pain is bad enough to keep me awake... Penetrex comes to the rescue and provides enough relief for me to finally get some rest.Now, I wish I could say it has completely replaced all pain medications, tens units, orthopedic devices, massage, etc. in my life - but that would require a miracle. It has, however, significantly decreased my reliance on those things. I have a good routine now, and if something aggravates my condition, Penetrex is there for me, without fail.I make sure I always have some on hand - the prospect of running out is definitely anxiety producing! My ex tried it and was so impressed he wanted to take my spare jar (yeah, that didn't happen).Bonus use for parents: my children know this is my "owie" cream, and I have successfully used it on their little bumps and bruises, when they just want you to "do something." You can't put a band-aid on every owie, but you can use a little Penetrex! And it REALLY helps my son's growing pains in his legs, and the occasional Charlie horse. As an added bonus, my 3 year old daughter takes great pride in helping apply the cream on mommy - yes, I still have to help rub it in, ha ha, but I'm hoping to prepare her for a life of servitude as my personal masseuse. author: Stu Howard
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2020
review_content: I was not sure what to make of the claims made on this product. But my wife has bad arthritis in a finger from an injury so I gave it a try. And it works. Sometimes it gets rid of the pain completely--within seconds--and other times it dulls it to tolerable while walking.Interestingly, I started using it my carpal tunnel syndrome--I usually use CBD cream, which works well--and all of a sudden the carpal tunnel symptoms worsened. I couldn't understand, as I'd not done anything to cause a flareup--but the tingling and numbness noticeably worsened. I realized I'd started using the Penetrex on my wrist. I stopped and the carpal tunnel symptoms dropped to their usual levels. Odd, to say the least, but it works so well on everything else that I figured that for whatever the reason one of the ingredients was causing a bad reaction. Regardless, I continue to use Penetrex for the arthritis and it works incredibly well.I'm sure the "penetrating" part is facilitated by the DMSO, a long-used compound for bringing a substance deep into a joint. I'll continue buying Penetrex for one reason: it works.

author: B. Boye
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2019
review_content: I have a left middle finger that can get "locked up" when forcing my fist tight, the so called "trigger finger" problem. However, when it does lock up the pain is still there.I started using Penetrex on the finger joint area where the tendon sheath caught up with the tendon, causing the pain. I also continued the physical therapy exercise recommended. It took a while for both to work, but I can say that my frequency of lockups and the pain level of lockups have both been reduced after a few months. I attribute the pain reduction to the anti-inflammatory character of Penetrex, albeit it took a while to notice the difference.I purchased the Penetrex cream type I have used and reviewed from Amazon. I just received a free sample of the roll-on type from the manufacturer that I intend to try later, but the free sample does not influence my review here regarding the cream type.

author: Roger
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2016
review_content: I thought I would try Penetrex because of all the good reviews I read about this product. I have severe osteoarthritis in my knee and will eventually need a knee replacement. I hope to put that off for as long as possible so I was looking for something that would help with the pain so I can get around more comfortably. I tried a couple of other creams, but this one seems to help the most. I am not totally pain free when using it, but I definitely think it helps. I use it every day and apply it 2 or 3 times a day. It took several days of applying it 3 or 4 times a day before I noticed a change when I first started using it...so don't give up if you don't feel immediate relief when you first start applying it. There have been times I didn't apply it for several days, and I noticed I felt more discomfort when that happened. That was a reminder for me to start using it regularly again. That is a true sign to me that Penetrex does help, and I continue to buy a new jar when my 4 oz. jar runs low. I first bought the smaller 2 oz. size jar to see if it worked for me before spending the money on the larger size jar. Now I only purchase the larger size. It isn't greasy and doesn't have an unpleasant smell so that is a plus as well.
title: It helps me with my arthritis related knee pain.

author: Y R DeLoach
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2019
review_content: It's not a pleasant feeling when your drawer full of creams, salves, ointments and patches are not effective anymore.The first time I applied Penetrex, it calmed down the nerve pain in my legs quickly.  It has helped with my sciatica and arthritis symptoms.  It has also helped to lessen the nerve pain caused by a compressed nerve in my lower spine.What I like is the fact that I can apply it and then use my heating pad or (very large) gel ice pad for those attacks that flare up in the early morning hours.  And, it feels very 'lavish' when smoothing on, almost like a facial cream.I only gave it four stars because it just doesn't last very long; within an hour the effects are wearing off.  I carry the roll-on with me everywhere, and keep a small jar in the kitchen and one in the bedroom. A little on the pricey side for me to use all the time, but I'll definitely keep some on hand for those bad pain days.

author: Ladybug
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2019
review_content: This is my 3rd jar. Now THIS is my 4th jar! I bought it under the 100% guarantee because it better bleeping work for almost $20! And it does. It's crazy good for pain relief, but it's not a good idea to use it, and then keep doing what you're doing because whatever hurts doesn't hurt now. date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2020

review_content: A true miracle. My best friend has said nothing but great things about this product so I figured I would give it a try. author: Leslie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2015
review_content: I have Chronic hip pain.  I put this on every night before I go to sleep and it really is amazing.  I used to take 2 Alieve before sleeping, and  don't  need to any more. Use it as directed and give it a few weeks.  I will NEVER stop using this stuff.Update Dec. 2015.Since I just received a new jar of Penetrex, I wanted to add an addendum to my above 5 star review.  The constant pain in my hip trochanter joint, that I have had for the past 20 years, finally decreased enough for me to sleep on my side for the first time in 10 years. It took about 2-3 weeks of diligent use as directed on the packaging.  Unfortunately, as I started feeling good, I became less diligent about using my Penetrex and the pain slowly ramped back up.  I started again on my nightly routine of rubbing Penetrex into the joint each night and the pain is again under control.  It will not make the joint feel temporarily cool, like  China Gel , but with regular use, it significantly reduces the pain of bursitis.  If you are unfamiliar with hip pain associated with Trochanteric bursitis here is some info:-  Trochanteric bursitis is inflammation of the bursa (fluid-filled sac near a joint) at the outside (lateral) point of the hip known as the greater trochanter. When this bursa becomes irritated or inflamed, it causes pain in the hip. This is a common cause of hip pain.-Trochanteric bursitis typically causes the following symptoms:Pain on the outside of the hip and thigh or in the buttock.Pain when lying on the affected side.Pain when you press in on the outside of the hip.Pain that gets worse during activities such as getting up from a deep chair or getting out of a car.
title: I put this on every night before I go to sleep and it really is amazing. I used to take 2 Alieve before sleeping

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2019
review_content: I have a chronic swelling in my knee due to 2 meniscus tears, and also my ankle, which has a torn tendon.  After reading multiple reviews, I purchased 2 jars of Penetrex, one for each of my homes.  The cream has a nice neutral scent and absorbs easily.  I do find that it helps reduce inflammation when I apply it regularly, about 3-4 times per day.  It is not a miracle worker, but it does help.  (When I am very active I use it in conjunction with an ice pack, which is better than the ice alone)I also purchased the roll on version, which I prefer, since it dries quickly and is very convenient to carry in my handbag.  ( I also like that I don’t have to wash my hands after sticking my fingers into a jar!).The company has an amazing customer service department.  They contacted me directly and sent me a free bottle of Penetrex, just for giving them my email address!  (I guess they rewarded me for being a good customer!). They did ask me to review the product, which I would have done anyway, but just didn’t have a chance to do until now.  (I carry this bottle in my bag with my dance shoes, and use it before and after dancing, to keep inflammation at bay.)I highly recommend the product and the company for both their customer service and amazing guarantee.p!
title: Great product, great customer service too!

review_content: I like the quick relief from pain and inflammation in the knee so that I could at least walk for a little distant before I must apply it again.You see, I have been in agony  sent July 2013 from knee replacement . date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2021
review_content: I tripped on a big rock in the dark while wearing flip flops and did a real number on my foot - didn't break it but damn near. title: Just plain WORKS

author: Danielle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2019
review_content: I, like you,  could not believe all the  five star reviews, thought for sure it was rigged.  Even went to the review checker site and determined that are 98% accurate, real buyers.I had my first long flight and suffer from a bulging L4, L5 and my SI joint and sciatica are constantly acting up because of them. Sitting in a cramped spot for even 20 minutes causes discomfort.  So i was panicked.  I decided to give this a go after my research along with a bunch of ridiculous blow up pillows, ziploc bags to beg for ice and pain meds (last resort). I had my bf rub this in really well to my lower back,  hips,  upper back,  neck,  shoulders right before boarding and crossed my fingers. I didn't want to jinx it but holy cow! Four hours in i was just fine.  I of course was getting up and stretching a bit a few times as well. 8 hours and i was still doing well.I thought there was a possibility it was in my head,  so tried it on the way back... same result.  I was able to return all those blow up pillows i never even used!Now at home my hip kills me at night for the same reasons.  I rub this in my lower back and it goes away 90% pretty much instantly.  I use it almost every night.I was a little concerned about how much was in the container but it goes a long way and it's actually bigger than you think when you see the "2 oz". Price wise,  great deal! Walmart also sells this,  they were a little more but that might be an option for some people:)I won't lie and say this is a cure for all aches and pains. I read some reviews where people complained it worked on some areas but not others or on their friends but not them. All i have to say is 1. make sure you are rubbing it in for a long time, fully absorbed 2. I tried this on my neck an unrelated time to the flight and it did not help me that much BUT it did another time.  3. All pains are caused by different things and every body is different.  Don't give up trying it one time in one spotAll in all,  i will keep this in the night stand, use it every time i need help sleeping and it will always be with me on flights knowing full well it isn't magic and might not work 100% sometimes.  It was completely worth it for me just to make it thru my flight alone.
title: Flight or nightstand essential!

author: Laureen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2019
review_content: I've had some serious pain in the last few years. Shoulder, arm, back. It's exhausting, being in pain for such a long period of time. I would get some relief from motrin and other oral pain medications, but you can't be taking those all the time. (Impact on kidneys etc.) I tried using mentholated topical ointments and creams. I tried Blue Emu cream too. They really didn't provide much, if any relief. Then I tried applying creams and patches that contained Lidocaine. These actually helped but I needed to keep on top of the applications for relief and I never got any better. Then I stumbled across Penetrex on Amazon. There were thousands, literally thousands, of positive reviews! I thought, What the heck, I'll give it a try. So I ordered a 2oz jar of Penetrex. I started out using it 4 times a day. I just used enough to cover the area that hurt and massaged the cream in until it was absorbed. I was surprised that I started feeling improvement within a couple of days! So after awhile I cut down to 3 times a day and then to 2 times a day. The relief is real and I am so glad that I took a chance on this product. It works!  I told a friend who was experiencing tennis elbow and she was very surprised that it worked for her too. Look, if you need surgery or have something severe going on, you should go to a doctor. But I have been to doctors. They would mostly prescribe an anti-inflamatory and physical therapy. So I would take the meds and do the P. T. but I wasn't getting the relief I needed.  This really did the job for me. I'm grateful to all the people who wrote reviews. They are the reason I tried Penetrex and as corny as it sounds, I'm very glad I did.
title: This actually works - Relief!

author: Joanne
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2019
review_content: I was very skeptical at first, having tried other topical pain relievers with little or no results. In fact, the first couple of times I used it I wondered if it was all in my head. Then my mom, who I had recommended it to a few months earlier, told me that she used it on her knees with great success. I woke up the next morning with a left knee that was aching so much I thought I would have to wear my brace that day. I rubbed some Penetrex on it and I didn’t even remember that my knee had been hurting when I ran downstairs to get a load of laundry out of the dryer before I went to work, the pain was gone within a few minutes. Now it’s neck, knees, elbows, hands, I even put some on my feet the other night. Whether I’m using it when I first get up in the morning or before I go to bed at night, it provides real relief. And if it hadn’t, there’s always the money back guarantee. So, you’ve really got nothing to lose.
title: I Call It  Miracle Cream!

author: AlexJouJou
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2020
review_content: I've been using several different creams for my various aches and pains as a marathon runner. A lot of CBD type creams and a lot of the hot/cold type creams. However, this one really works for me. In particular it has been super helpful for achilles tendinitis and plantar fasciitis pains. I rub in multiple times a day and I notice way less pain and what seems like quicker recovery when I have it. These tend to be chronic issues - and they will go away for a while but come back if I'm not 100% on top of my strength training, stretching, meditation and just general wellness.I looked it up and I first purchased this cream in 2014 - for achilles issues. I liked it then and, when those same type of issues flared again along with some heel pain I went back and searched for what I used before. This was it. A lot of the other creams work maybe better for immediate pain relief but my observation is that this brings pain relief AND healing to where the issue starts to go away and eventually disappears (note: I am also doing other things that contribute like examining my running gait and making sure my nutrition is good and so on). This cream does exceptionally well at inflammation reduction. In fact, better than pain reduction IMHO.I like this so well I ordered another 2 oz, the larger jar, and the roll on. I'm not going to spend hard earned dollars on something that doesn't work. I don't belong to any discount club nor did I receive any compensation for this item. I purchased it, genuinely like it, and wanted to share that with you. I don't think it's a miracle - and do go see your doctor if your pain continues or you haven't been properly diagnosed. But for those of us who have a more chronic need this is a pretty decent value for healing and pain relief.

author: Kim
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2020
review_content: This product has been a liver saver and yes I mean LIVER bc I'm not having to take as much over the counter pain medication to help with my aches and pains. review_content: When I first tried it, I didn't think it was working. I was going through Icy Hot roll on like crazy (morning, noon, and night). I have pain and swelling in the foot, ankle, and calf.I did not get any relief on any of these areas from the PENETREX cream. The texture is nice-- kind of silky, but still greasy. date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2020
review_content: This review is for the cream version of the product. Penetrex works rapidly to relieve (and, I believe, heal) tendonitis pain. review_content: I am in my 60's and have had both knees replaced successfully but, when I had my left hip replaced, there was some nerve damage which has resulted in weakness in my left leg. author: SteubenOhio
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2019
review_content: I have sciatic nerve pain that just shoots down my thigh due to spinal back problems. I had surgery in 2010 in which I have pins and screws in my spine. I went through a straight year of therapy 3 days a week to get myself back to the 80% health that m doctor told me I could reach if I did everything he recommended I do to get back to a close to pain free normal life. To my surprise I did it and it worked. I was living a normal life after a year. But come 8 years later the sciatica pain came back and it was determined that it is my spine again but this time I have a chance to hopefully not have to go to surgery, at least not yet. I am doing therapy and had taken a 12 day dose of steroids. Both is helping but the steroids totally stopped the streak of thigh pain. Only problem it didn't stop the pain for as long as we hoped, pain returned after 56 days of finishing the steroids. I'm still doing therapy but I do get the pain though thigh but not real bad but enough to slow down my life. So I got on Amazon and looked for a sciatica pain relief and I came across this Penetrex Theraphy cream and after reading reviews I decided there was so much good written that I needed to try this, so purchase I did. Believe you/ me I rubbed this cream on my back and I had immediate results. It is a miracle cream. It took  85% of the sharp streaking pain away from my thigh. I do use it at least 3 times a day and I get wonderful results. I want you all to know that even though I use this I also complete my physical therapy 5 days a week as well. I have not just used this non steroid inflammation cream alone, so therefore I just wanted to make that clear. But if you have pain from sciatica believe me you need to strongly consider purchasing this and giving it a chance. I am so glad I gave this product a try which was hard for me for I had used icy hot, the patch, many off the shelf meds and nothing worked for more than the time it took to wear off which was no more than a few hours. If you use this like it's instructed you will get long time relief, even an all 8 hours of restful sleep. Some say it is pricey but in my opinion you pay for what you get and I don't think it's too pricey to pay if it keeps my pain down to a minimum and keeps me from another long agonizing surgery and recovery. Just run it in your skin and feel the relief.

author: Ramnath
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2019
review_content: I have been a gout sufferer since the time I was 27 years old, and now I have had it for 21 years and still dread an attack, and try and take every precaution I can, to ward it off before it sets in, however, you cannot escape it sometimes and when it does come, its generally with vengeance. I am sure there are many who share the fear that I do even at the thought of an attack, the uncontrollable and unimaginable stinging and stabbing pain, just when you just about close your eyes after days sleeplessness and fatigue. Its living hell.For years I kept trying to do and follow all I read and heard, ACV, baking soda, colchicine, black cherry juice, Lemon juice, raw food, Papaya tea, stopped beer, wine, drink crazy amounts of water, but like we all know it will get you if it decides to. The worst thing other than the constant and incredible pain is the sudden buckling, stabbing and the poking of the affected as if with a burning hot steel knife and the sleeplessness because of the stinging pain and the helplessness only the sufferers will know, I am sure all of us who go through severe attacks would have considered amputation 😊, Well the ones who don’t have it will never understand.I used to keep looking at every source, Google, Amazon, books, magazines for something, anything that will take away the edge of the knife stab-like pain and have tried every cream or painkiller available. Purchasing the first jar of Penetrex was one such experiment as well. I will not ever say that it gets rid of gout pain, but it is a champion in taking the sting out of the debilitating pain for a reasonable length of time, and that’s all sometimes one needs when you are undergoing such an attack, for sleep to set in which aids in healing quicker.I am thankful and grateful that I did it, It is a life saver, I have even purchased and sent it to a cousin of mine in India who suffers just the way I do when I have an attack, I generally get the attack either on my big toe or the ankle and trust me this helps in lowering the pain to very manageable levels. I can't be certain that it probably has the same effect on any of you who try it, but I pray it does.I generally do not write reviews and am lazy about it, however, this one definitely needs a mention and surely deserves to be shared Even if one gout sufferer is benefited, I guess this review would have achieved its purpose.
title: Gout sufferers - You deserve to read this

author: EPayne
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2019
review_content: I sound like an old man when I say this, but I wish I'd found this product 25 years ago.  Maybe it wasn't around.  It's awesome.  I've always been pretty active, running, soccer, ice hockey, weights, basketball here and there.  Anyway, I've had a fair share of injuries over the years and this would've been a life saver...it WAS a life saver.I rolled my ankle this summer, quite badly.  Oddly enough, I was able to get the R&R I needed for the first 48 hrs after injury.  I applied penetrex about 3-5 times a day, had it on ice, and elevated.  It felt sooooooo much better that I even played softball (in a limited capacity)  about 24 hrs later.  But, this stuff was awesome.  I've continued to keep some on hand since then and it's been a lifesaver.  I love this product.
title: Wish I'd found this 25 years ago

author: BothSidesNow
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2018
review_content: I have been using Penetrex for years - mostly for minor muscle aches from an ambitious workout or waking up with a stiff neck. My fiance is a drummer and would use it to soothe his hands, wrists, and arms after a hard-hitting gig. But we hadn't had occasion to REALLY put it to the test until now - I was in a car accident a couple of weeks ago and got pretty banged up. In addition to a fractured foot, both of my knees were severely painfully bruised (they must have hit the dashboard), and my right hand and wrist were badly strained and bruised from trying to brace myself from the impact. My palm and the area between my thumb and pointer finger (where I grasped the steering wheel) were a dark purple. I also had deep bruising across my chest where the seat belt dug into me. Overall, a lot of deep bruising, wrenched joints, and injured tissue.Since we didn't have to use it that much, I still had the jar of Penetrex I bought years ago, but I noticed it had expired, so I just purchased a fresh one, along with the new roll-on. I started using the old one while waiting to receive the new one and I think it helped a bit, but I really noticed a difference when I started using the fresh Penetrex. Within days, the deep purple bruising on my palm was almost gone. My right wrist feels a lot better, although it still hurts when I move it at certain angles (I'm hoping that it will continue improving, though the Dr. warned that there's a long-term  risk for carpal tunnel syndrome with an injury like this. Let's hope Penetrex can help me stave that off).Both my knees are healing nicely - pain and bruising have greatly diminished and the bruising across my chest is gone. I tend to heal well, but I feel that Penetrex accelerated that process with respect to the bruising and pain from the accident. The fractured foot is another story - I have had to have surgery to repair a displaced calcaneal fracture and I am looking at a lengthy healing process with that. Given the long-term prognosis for potential residual issues for this type of fracture, I am hoping Penetrex will help me there. I have a positive outlook on my healing ability, but I'll take all the help I can get :)I do a lot of research into whatever I put in and on my body and I lean toward as natural a healing process as I can (given that, I am also grateful for an expert surgeon who put my heel back together). I like that Penetrex's healing ingredients are well-researched natural elements, not pharmaceutical synthetics. I like the convenience of the roll-on, but I think I prefer the therapeutic act of rubbing the cream into the injured area.This is one healing product that I will always make sure to have on hand - and from now on, I'll take care to keep an eye on the expiration date so I have a fresh full-strength jar when I need it. I hope you don't need it as badly as I did. But even for routine aches, this will help you.
title: We've been using Penetrex for years, but my recent car accident really put it to the test.

author: Jake
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2020
review_content: When I was 15 years old I had a Snowboarding accident where I dislocated my left elbow; though, the way it dislocated made it like putting a square peg into a round hole to put it back in place. Also with arthritis heavy in my family on both sides, I know when it rains before the forecast does.Penetrex was referred to me by my mother who suffers similar arthritis issues...and IT WORKS! date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2020
review_content: This stuff really works!  I'll be honest, I'm a senior and I didn't think that it would work for me because of my age and the fact that I was in so much discomfort. author: Bobbie BZ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
review_content: I had wrist surgery a year ago.  When they wrapped my hand and sent me home, the wrap was entirely too tight.  I had been told not to mess with it.  After a day, my thumb and hand was so very swollen and the more it swelled, the more it hurt.  It was cutting off blood supply.  A nurse friend of mine came over, cut part of the bandage between thumb and forefinger, relieving much pressure.  However, it had done nerve damage, causing numbness in my thumb and surrounding area.  My doctor said the nerve may never heal.  I began massaging Penetrex into the area 3 times per day, and by the end of a month, I had feeling back in my thumb and no more pain.  Periodically, even now, it may ache just a tad...I get out my Penetrex and voila! much better.  I also use it for my SCM muscle, and upper back and shoulder muscles which I've been having much trouble with.  Helps a great deal.  I think before long, I won't need to be using it on a daily basis.  At least it's down to just once per day now.
title: It helps to heal the nerves, tendons, muscles

author: Jason J. Marchi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2021
review_content: By pure happy accident, I tried this product on my very bad toenail fungus, applying it four to five times a day to the affected nails. Within a month I saw a marked improvement of the mail (far less yellowing), so I continued using it.  Within a year the fungus was GONE and new nail growth replaced the damaged nail. I just had my physical with my primary care physician and showed him the results. He was amazed by the improvement, having warned me that getting rid of toenail fungus is very difficult. He also studied the ingredients and thought it might be the B vitamins that did the trick. Before this, I tried EVERY anti-fungal specifically marketed for toe fungus and nothing worked. I continue to use Penetrex on the toenails once each morning before putting on socks for the day, and once at night when I get home from work after my feet have been trapped in shoes all day, and no toenail fungus has returned.
title: Penetrex Cured My Toenail Fungus

author: LMW
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2016
review_content: Penetrex has become a staple around our house.  I now subscribe to it due to the great relief it has brought to my mother and me.  My mother is 90 and was experiencing such pain in her foot  that she was afraid she'd have to move to a nursing home as she could hardly walk on it in the mornings.  (She lives with me).  She also suffered from pain in her toes if the sheets touched them at night.  Add on to those problems regular old age  problems with knees, hips, and shoulders, and she was miserable.  After just one jar of Penetrex, she is suffering no longer!!!  She keeps it on her bed, and if she wakens to any pain, she just applies a tiny amount and the pain disappears. She has no trouble walking on her foot  in the mornings. She is tight with her money, but she says this money is very well spent and doesn't plan on quitting it!Now to my problems.  I am a cancer patient and have a lot of lower back pain due to two emergency back surgeries in 2012.  My mother has applied Penetrex to my lower back and I have felt relief.  More importantly, I have residual pain from Shingles three years ago.  It is excruciating, but the Penetrex has given me total relief on my back.  It used to feel like hot coals were on my back, but that pain is gone. My mother applies it to my back for me every other night, and that pain has disappeared.  I apply it under my left breast and the pain is still there, but to a much smaller degree.  When the stabbing pains hit, they are much milder and go away much quicker.We are grateful that we found this product.  The reviews on Amazon encouraged us to try it, and we were amazed.  I wanted to write this review so others may see what it has done for us.  It is a miracle cream for us.  I hope it will be for you, too. I realize it works differently for individuals, but I think it is worth a try.  I highly recommend Penetrex.
title: Our Miracle Worker

review_content: I'm plagued by aches & pains. It is the burden of hard work and being human. date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020
review_content: As I’m aging I’m having pain in my lower back and hip from prior sports-related injuries that is gettin worse and act up even from going on a casual stroll. date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2016
review_content: I began using penetrex desperate to find ANYTHING that would help with all the pain from my fibromyalgia and autoimmune disease issues...and this cream has been pivotal in keeping my pain under control!! author: It's just me
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2016
review_content: Imagine my shock receiving a thank you note & a wonderful offer from the kind folks at Penetrex!  They requested a review, good, bad, or indifferent.  Since it happens to be the ONLY OTC product that has given me any relief for several years now, how could I refuse?Long story short, I've been blessed with RA, OA, Fibro & a few more A's that I can't spell.  Oh, an awful rotator? cuff to top it off.  My doc wanted & still wants me to see a Rummy doc which I refuse to do.  I won't take an aspirin let alone take the drugs that are being pushed; the main one I know is toxic.So the search began......First - vitamins & supplements.  Pretty good since my vitamin D level was where it should have been but the pain & inflammation was still horrible.Next - Essential oil concoctions.  Smelled good but no relief.Then - The 'blue' stuff, the cold stuff, the heat stuff......no relief.Okay now what?  Why are there so many great reviews for this Penetrex stuff?  They can't all be true & I'm really tired of spending money without results.  At this point I have no choice; seeing the Rummy or giving Penetrex a shot & boy am I glad I choose the Penetrex.  No, I'm not 100% pain free, but, I can function again.  It really works wonders on my back, neck, elbows & shoulder.  It also relieves some of the inflammation in my hands & feet, but just getting rid of that "knife in my back" pain makes it priceless.Not greasy, not smelly, just apply & go.BTW, my daughter developed 'arthritis thumb' (yes there is such a thing) from years of book-keeping & I gave her part of my jar; YES, no pain.  Now she orders it herself.I'd like to thank the Penetrex staff for a wonderful product & giving me this opportunity to share my opinion.Sorry if this is longer than it should have been. date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020
review_content: I've suffered horrible bilateral leg neuropathy for 15+ years (insulin dependent for 65 years), and have experimented with ever prescription drug on the market as well as the holistic (aroma, sound and light) therapies, hypnosis and acupuncture. author: aquarian52

review_content: I hurt my lower back somehow and it was quite painful and stiff.  Getting older is no fun.  I took Tylenol and Aspirin together and it helped a little. author: Ed W
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2019
review_content: I have had a swelling in my right foot for nearly a year and the podiatrist says that it is inflammation on a nerve. I do tend to favor my right foot and that has also led to some ankle pain in my right ankle.  I bought this product for my wife's arthritis in her hands and decided to try it on my foot and ankle. author: JayC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2018
review_content: I first began using Penetrex a couple of years ago to aid in the healing process of my broken femur bone...I did not want to take pain meds (Percocet) etc.  I elected Penetrex because of the principle of penetration applied to getting the formulated ingredients where it is needed to do its work.  The product worked for me and became an integral part of my total rehabilitation plan.  Penetrex worked just fine doing its part in keeping the nerves quiet...and more!  I had suffered a condition called "Trigger Finger" for 16 years...I couldn't so much as "flip the bird" without my finger sticking at the lowest apex. Not that that was a problem, but  I tried a variation of ointments, splints, braces...even a ring to prevent my finger ( next to pinky) from sticking in the downward position...then, getting it straight again was akin to dislocation...fun and pain.  While applying and massaging my leg (femur) with the cream, I soon found that my finger no longer stuck in the down position!... I was healed...! No more rude painful awakening while trying to sleep, with a stuck finger needing to be popped back into place...Thank you...to all the people of Penetrex...for making this product possible ...you have made a life-long consumer...did I mention?...the femur rehab was also a success.  Today, I am using Penetrex for Peripheral Neuropathy symptoms...it is of great aid in quieting the nerves...in fact...I recommended it to my wife...she likes how creamy and fresh it is to use, not to mention that it stopped the bottoms of her feet from burning.
